column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,austin.germani@gsa.gov,,"This advertisement is hereby incorporated into the RLP 22-REG_1CA2694 by way of reference as an RLP attachment. U.S. GOVERNMENT seeks to lease the following office space through the Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP): City: Yreka State: CA??????????????? ?????? Delineated Area:??????????????? ??????? Minimum ABOA Sq. Ft.: ?4,910? Maximum ABOA Sq. Ft.:? 5,150? ??????????? Space Type: Office???? ?? Term*:??? 15/13? Amortization Term:??????? For 15/13 Lease Terms: 8 years for both Tenant Improvements?and Building Specific Amortized Capital???????????????????????????????????? ????????? *Offerors are encouraged to submit rates for all terms available in the AAAP for consideration against future GSA requirements. Agency Unique Requirements:?????????????????????? ???? Agency Tenant Improvement Allowance????????????? Existing leased space:?????? $71.336760 per ABOA SF Other locations offered:????? $71.336760per ABOA SF Building Specific Amortized Capital (BSAC)??????? Existing leased space:??????? ?????? $12.00per ABOA SF Other locations offered:?????? ?????? $12.00per ABOA SF ? IMPORTANT NOTES: Offerors are advised to familiarize themselves with the telecommunications prohibitions outlined under Section 889 of the FY19 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), as implemented by Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). For more information, visit: https://acquisition.gov/FAR-Case-2019-009/889_Part_B Offerors are advised that all Shell work associated with delivering the Tenant Improvements are at the Lessor?s cost.? Please refer to Section 3?(Construction Standards and Shell Components)?and specifically to Paragraph 3.07?(Building Shell Requirements)?of the?AAAP RLP Attachment #2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP ) for more detail.? Tenant Improvement Components are detailed under Section 5 of the? AAAP RLP Attachment?#2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP) .? ? It is highly recommended that offerors start the SAM registration process directly following the offer submission.? Refer to RLP Clause 3.06, Item 7. (If applicable) The Government intends to award a Lease to an Offeror of a Building that is in compliance with Seismic Standards. Section 2.03 of the Request for Lease Proposals (RLP) outlines compliance activities required for all leases in moderate or high seismic zones. To determine if your property lies in a moderate or high zone, please reference the map and documents on our website.? HOW TO OFFER: The Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP), located at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap, will enable interested parties to offer space for lease to the Federal Government in response to the FY22 AAAP RLP.? In addition, the Government will use its AAAP to satisfy the above space requirement. Offerors must go to the AAAP website, select the ?Register to Offer Space? link and follow the instructions to register.? Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the AAAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the AAAP website. Once registered, interested parties may enter offers during any ?Open Period?. For technical assistance with AAAP, email LOP.help@gsa.gov. The Open Period is the 1st through the 7th of each month, ending at 7:30 p.m. (ET) unless otherwise stated by the Government and unless the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday. If the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday, the Open Period will end at 7:30 PM (ET) on the next business day. Refer to AAAP RLP paragraph 3.02.A for more details on the offer submission process. The Government reserves the right to allow for multiple Open Periods prior to selecting an offer for award to meet this specific space requirement.? Offers cannot be submitted during the Closed Period and will not be considered for projects executed during that time period. Lease award will be made to the lowest price, technically acceptable offer, without negotiations, based upon the requirements in this advertisement and in the RLP requirements package found on the AAAP website.? During an Open Period, offerors will be permitted to submit new offers or modify existing offers.? Offerors can draft an offer at any time; however, you can only submit an offer during the Open Period. The offered space must comply with the requirements in this advertisement and the RLP and must meet Federal Government, State, and Local jurisdiction requirements, including requirements for fire and life safety, security, accessibility, seismic, energy, and sustainability standards in accordance with the terms of the Lease.? The Lease and all documents that constitute the Lease package can be found at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap. ?If you have previously submitted an offer in FY 2021, the AAAP application has a copy feature which will allow existing offers to be copied over to the FY 2022 RLP in order to avoid having to re-enter all of the data manually. Please be sure to review FY22 AAAP RLP Package and each page within the AAAP Application prior to submitting your offer as some of the questions have changed. You must re-enter your space and rates on the ?Space and Rates? tab in the AAAP. Your previous offered space will not be copied."

column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,brandy.pilco@gsa.gov,,"RLP Procurement Summary ??????????????????????????????????? GSA Public Buildings Service U.S. GOVERNMENT General Services Administration (GSA) seeks to lease the following space: State: Arizona City: Tuba City Delineated Area: N: Arizona Blvd S: Navajo Trail to Moenave to Mains St. E: Peshlakai Ave W: Arizona Blvd Minimum Sq. Ft. (ABOA): 2,780 Maximum Sq. Ft. (ABOA): 3,100 Space Type: Office Parking Spaces (Total): 0 Parking Spaces (Surface): N/A Parking Spaces (Structured): N/A Parking Spaces (Reserved): N/A Full Term: 180 months Firm Term: 120 months Option Term: N/A Additional Requirements: N/A Offered space must meet Government requirements for fire safety, accessibility, seismic, and sustainability standards per the terms of the Lease.? A fully serviced lease is required.? Offered space shall not be in the 100 year flood plain. Entities are advised to familiarize themselves with the telecommunications prohibitions outlined under Section 889 of the FY19 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), as implemented by the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR).? ). ?For more information, visit: https://acquisition.gov/FAR-Case-2019-009/889_Part_B. Offers Due: June 24, 2022 Occupancy (Estimated): December 2024 Electronic Offer Submission: Offers must be submitted electronically through the Requirement Specific Acquisition Platform (RSAP), located at https://lop.gsa.gov/rsap/. Interested parties must go to the RSAP website, select the ?Registration? link and follow the instructions to register. ?Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the RSAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the RSAP website. Solicitation Number: Solicitation (RLP) Number 8AZ2237 Government Contact Information (Not for Offer Submission) Lease Contracting Officer 213-894-0574 brandy.pilco@gsa.gov Note:?? Entities not currently registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) are advised to start the registration process as soon as possible."

column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,stephen.janssen@gsa.gov,,"This advertisement is hereby incorporated into the RLP 22-REG09 by way of reference as an RLP attachment. U.S. GOVERNMENT seeks to lease the following office space through the Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP): City: Salinas and Monterey State:??????? CA??????????? ??? Delineated Area: The City limits of Salinas and?Monterey, CA? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?? Minimum ABOA Sq. Ft.:?? 2,822? ??????????? Maximum ABOA Sq. Ft.:? 3,245? Space Type:??? Office????????????????? Agency Unique Requirements:? ? ? ? ?Offered space must be contiguous on one floor.? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?? Agency Tenant Improvement Allowance included in offer? :?????? ?? $___74.09___ per ABOA SF Building Specific Amortized Capital (BSAC) included in offer:?????? $___10___ per ABOA SF ? IMPORTANT NOTES: Offerors are advised to familiarize themselves with the telecommunications prohibitions outlined under Section 889 of the FY19 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), as implemented by Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). For more information, visit: https://acquisition.gov/FAR-Case-2019-009/889_Part_B Offerors are advised that all Shell work associated with delivering the Tenant Improvements are at the Lessor?s cost.? Please refer to Section 3?(Construction Standards and Shell Components)?and specifically to Paragraph 3.07?(Building Shell Requirements)?of the?AAAP RLP Attachment #2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP ) for more detail.? Tenant Improvement Components are detailed under Section 5 of the? AAAP RLP Attachment?#2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP) .? ? It is highly recommended that offerors start the SAM registration process directly following the offer submission. Refer to RLP Clause 3.06, Item 7. (If applicable) The Government intends to award a Lease to an Offeror of a Building that is in compliance with Seismic Standards. Section 2.03 of the Request for Lease Proposals (RLP) outlines compliance activities required for all leases in moderate or high seismic zones. To determine if your property lies in a moderate or high zone, please reference the map and documents on our website. HOW TO OFFER: The Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP), located at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap, will enable interested parties to offer space for lease to the Federal Government in response to RLP 22-REG09. In addition, the Government will use its AAAP to satisfy the above space requirement. Offerors must go to the AAAP website, select the ?Register to Offer Space? link and follow the instructions to register. Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the AAAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the AAAP website. Once registered, interested parties may enter offers during any ?Open Period?. For technical assistance with AAAP, email LOP.help@gsa.gov. The Open Period is the 1st through the 7th of each month, ending at 7:30 p.m. (ET) unless otherwise stated by the Government and unless the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday. If the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday, the Open Period will end at 7:30 PM (ET) on the next business day. Refer to AAAP RLP paragraph 3.02.A for more details on the offer submission process. The Government reserves the right to allow for multiple Open Periods prior to selecting an offer for award to meet this specific space requirement. Offers cannot be submitted during the Closed Period and will not be considered for projects executed during that time period. Lease award will be made to the lowest price, technically acceptable offer, without negotiations, based upon the requirements in this advertisement and in the RLP requirements package found on the AAAP website. During an Open Period, offerors will be permitted to submit new offers or modify existing offers. Offerors can draft an offer at any time; however, you can only submit an offer during the Open Period. The offered space must comply with the requirements in this advertisement and the RLP and must meet Federal Government, State, and Local jurisdiction requirements, including requirements for fire and life safety, security, accessibility, seismic, energy, and sustainability standards in accordance with the terms of the Lease. The Lease and all documents that constitute the Lease package can be found at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap. If you have previously submitted an offer in FY 2021, the AAAP application has a copy feature which will allow existing offers to be copied over to the FY 2022 RLP in order to avoid having to re-enter all of the data manually. Please be sure to review FY22 AAAP RLP Package and each page within the AAAP Application prior to submitting your offer as some of the questions have changed. You must re-enter your space and rates on the ?Space and Rates? tab in the AAAP. Your previous offered space will not be copied."

column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,CA,RFQ for Commercial Real Estate Brokerage Services,State/Local,,"Santa Monica, California","Jun 30, 2022","Santa Monica, California",https://finance.smgov.net/doing-business/procurement/overview#toc-submit-your-bid-,"2021-REQ-00093
column3: ",Purchasing Department,,310-458-8242,,,"The City of Santa Monica (City) is soliciting Statement of Qualifications (SOQ) from a number of qualified real estate brokers with commercial real estate knowledge and experience to provide leasing services for City-owned properties. Property types include retail, restaurant, vending carts and kiosks, office, and/or creative space. Through this RFQ, the City will establish a list of pre-qualified brokers (Broker List) based on broker specialization from which the City may contract to provide leasing services based on property type and broker experience/qualification. The Broker List may be refreshed as needed to be determined by the City. This RFQual is not an exclusive leasing contract for all City-owned properties. Brokers are invited to submit qualifications for one or more property specialization(s).

column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,CA,"GSA Seeks to Lease Storage/Warehouse Space in Los Angeles, CA_0CA2983_Solicitation",Federal,,General Services Administration,"Jul 12, 2022",General Services Administration,https://sam.gov/opp/7c4b720e041148c7ae2cc31f3342de85/view,"0CA2983
column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,Alistair.Whatley@gsa.gov,,"General Services Administration (GSA) seeks to lease the following space: State: CA City: Los Angeles Delineated Area: North: 101 FWY South: 10 FWY East: 101 FWY to 10 FWY West: 110 FWY Minimum Sq. Ft. (ABOA): 6,111 (including a minimum of 200 SF Office) Maximum Sq. Ft. (ABOA): 6,722 Space Type: Office Parking Spaces (Total): 2 Parking Spaces (Surface): 2 Parking Spaces (Structured): 0 Parking Spaces (Reserved): 2 Full Term: 10 Firm Term: 10 Option Term: One ? 5 Year Renewal Option Additional Requirements: 1. The space will be used to store documents and must accommodate a minimum floor load of 150 lbs per square foot. 2. Doors from loading area to storage space must accommodate pallets. 3. Office space to have HVAC. 4. Minimum ceiling height of 10ft to accommodate shelving. 5. Separate office area with a minimum of 200 ABOA SF. 6. If the storage space is not directly accessible from the loading area, then elevator(s) required. Offered space must meet Government requirements for fire safety, accessibility, seismic, and sustainability standards per the terms of the Lease.? A fully serviced lease is required.? Offered space shall not be in the 100-year flood plain. Entities are advised to familiarize themselves with the telecommunications prohibitions outlined under Section 889 of the FY19 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), as implemented by the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR).? ). ?For more information, visit: https://acquisition.gov/FAR-Case-2019-009/889_Part_B. ************************************************************************************************ Offers Due: 07/12/2022 Occupancy (Estimated): 03/17/2023 Send Offers to: Name/Title: Alistair Whatley/Leasing Specialist Address: 300 N. Los Angeles St. Suite 4300 Office:?(213) 509-2776 Email Address: alistair.whatley@gsa.gov Government Contact Information Lease Contracting Officer - Pedro Zepeda Leasing Specialist - Alistair Whatley Broker - N/A Note:?? Entities not currently registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) are advised to start the registration process as soon as possible."

IDF closet shall be maintained at 68 degrees Fahrenheit with humidity control no to exceed 60% relative humidity. Property must be within 1/3 mile (1,584 feet) from public transportation. Property must be within 1/3 mile (1,584 feet) from a minimum of two commercial food service facilities. Facility Security Level (?FSL?):???????? Facility Security Level II ""The Government anticipates that the Tenant Improvement buildout for this requirement may exceed the allowance by approximately $82.305699 per ABOA SF. The Government will use the TI Allowance as stated above in evaluating the TI rent component of offers; however, this does not preclude the Government from consideration of move-related replications costs in the evaluation, as outlined under RLP 22-REG09 Paragraph 4.04 ?Present Value Price Evaluation (AAAP Variation).? The disclosure of this potential overage is not intended to be construed as an estimate of move-related replications costs. Also, it is not intended to serve as either an accurate estimate or an agreement by the Government as to the final pricing of the TI work, nor is it a commitment by the Government as to the level of TI work that eventually will be required. This disclosure is only intended to assist Offerors in understanding their potential obligation with respect to financing the full amount of Tenant improvements, as outlined under the Lease Paragraph 1.06 ?Tenant Improvement Rental Adjustment (AAAP Variation).? Agency Tenant Improvement Allowance Existing leased space:?????? N/A Other locations offered:???? $67.209841 per ABOA SF Building Specific Amortized Capital (BSAC) Existing leased space:?????? N/A Other locations offered:???? $11.602953 per ABOA SF ? IMPORTANT NOTES: Offerors are advised to familiarize themselves with the telecommunications prohibitions outlined under Section 889 of the FY19 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), as implemented by Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). For more information, visit: https://acquisition.gov/FAR-Case-2019-009/889_Part_B Offerors are advised that all Shell work associated with delivering the Tenant Improvements are at the Lessor?s cost.? Please refer to Section 3?(Construction Standards and Shell Components)?and specifically to Paragraph 3.07?(Building Shell Requirements)?of the?AAAP RLP Attachment #2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP ) for more detail.? Tenant Improvement Components are detailed under Section 5 of the? AAAP RLP Attachment?#2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP) .? ? It is highly recommended that offerors start the SAM registration process directly following the offer submission.? Refer to RLP Clause 3.06, Item 7. (If applicable) The Government intends to award a Lease to an Offeror of a Building that is in compliance with Seismic Standards. Section 2.03 of the Request for Lease Proposals (RLP) outlines compliance activities required for all leases in moderate or high seismic zones. To determine if your property lies in a moderate or high zone, please reference the map and documents on our website.? HOW TO OFFER: The Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP), located at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap, will enable interested parties to offer space for lease to the Federal Government in response to RLP 22-REG09.? In addition, the Government will use its AAAP to satisfy the above space requirement. Offerors must go to the AAAP website, select the ?Register to Offer Space? link and follow the instructions to register.? Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the AAAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the AAAP website. Once registered, interested parties may enter offers during any ?Open Period?. For technical assistance with AAAP, email LOP.help@gsa.gov. The Open Period is the 1st through the 7th of each month, ending at 7:30 p.m. (ET) unless otherwise stated by the Government and unless the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday. If the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday, the Open Period will end at 7:30 PM (ET) on the next business day. Refer to AAAP RLP paragraph 3.02.A for more details on the offer submission process. The Government reserves the right to allow for multiple Open Periods prior to selecting an offer for award to meet this specific space requirement.? Offers cannot be submitted during the Closed Period and will not be considered for projects executed during that time period. Lease award will be made to the lowest price, technically acceptable offer, without negotiations, based upon the requirements in this advertisement and in the RLP requirements package found on the AAAP website.? During an Open Period, offerors will be permitted to submit new offers or modify existing offers.? Offerors can draft an offer at any time; however, you can only submit an offer during the Open Period. The offered space must comply with the requirements in this advertisement and the RLP and must meet Federal Government, State, and Local jurisdiction requirements, including requirements for fire and life safety, security, accessibility, seismic, energy, and sustainability standards in accordance with the terms of the Lease.? The Lease and all documents that constitute the Lease package can be found at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap. ?If you have previously submitted an offer in FY 2021, the AAAP application has a copy feature which will allow existing offers to be copied over to the FY 2022 RLP in order to avoid having to re-enter all of the data manually. Please be sure to review FY22 AAAP RLP Package and each page within the AAAP Application prior to submitting your offer as some of the questions have changed. You must re-enter your space and rates on the ?Space and Rates? tab in the AAAP. Your previous offered space will not be copied."

Section 2.03 of the Request for Lease Proposals (RLP) outlines compliance activities required for all leases in moderate or high seismic zones. To determine if your property lies in a moderate or high zone, please reference the map and documents on our website. HOW TO OFFER: The Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP), located at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap, will enable interested parties to offer space for lease to the Federal Government in response to RLP 22-REG09. In addition, the Government will use its AAAP to satisfy the above space requirement. Offerors must go to the AAAP website, select the ?Register to Offer Space? link and follow the instructions to register. Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the AAAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the AAAP website. Once registered, interested parties may enter offers during any ?Open Period?. For technical assistance with AAAP, email LOP.help@gsa.gov. The Open Period is the 1st through the 7th of each month, ending at 7:30 p.m. (ET) unless otherwise stated by the Government and unless the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday. If the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday, the Open Period will end at 7:30 PM (ET) on the next business day. Refer to AAAP RLP paragraph 3.02.A for more details on the offer submission process. The Government reserves the right to allow for multiple Open Periods prior to selecting an offer for award to meet this specific space requirement. Offers cannot be submitted during the Closed Period and will not be considered for projects executed during that time period. Lease award will be made to the lowest price, technically acceptable offer, without negotiations, based upon the requirements in this advertisement and in the RLP requirements package found on the AAAP website. During an Open Period, offerors will be permitted to submit new offers or modify existing offers. Offerors can draft an offer at any time; however, you can only submit an offer during the Open Period. The offered space must comply with the requirements in this advertisement and the RLP and must meet Federal Government, State, and Local jurisdiction requirements, including requirements for fire and life safety, security, accessibility, seismic, energy, and sustainability standards in accordance with the terms of the Lease. The Lease and all documents that constitute the Lease package can be found at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap. If you have previously submitted an offer in FY 2021, the AAAP application has a copy feature which will allow existing offers to be copied over to the FY 2022 RLP in order to avoid having to re-enter all of the data manually. Please be sure to review FY22 AAAP RLP Package and each page within the AAAP Application prior to submitting your offer as some of the questions have changed. You must re-enter your space and rates on the ?Space and Rates? tab in the AAAP. Your previous offered space will not be copied."

column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,CA,RFP for Purchase and Development Opportunity,State/Local,,"Long Beach, California","Jun 13, 2022","Long Beach, California",,"RFP DV22-050
column3: ",Purchasing Officer,,562-570-6200,,,"The City of Long Beach (City) is soliciting proposals for the purchase and development of the property located at 4151 E. Fountain Street (Site) to create quality affordable housing for lower-income residents. The goal of this solicitation is to develop new neighborhood-appropriate, affordable rental housing for persons with developmental disabilities, or for senior housing. The site is improved with a 16,485 sq. ft. single-story assisted living facility. The City will consider proposals which include demolition of the existing structure with new construction, as well as proposals for rehabilitation and expansion of the existing structure.

Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,CA,RFP for Affordable Residential Developer for Oak Park,State/Local,,"Sacramento Housing and Redevelopment Agency, California",Today ,"Sacramento Housing and Redevelopment Agency, California",https://www.shra.org/doing-business-with-shra/,"RFP #2211-DD
column3: ",Purchasing,,916-566-1200,,,"The Sacramento Housing and Redevelopment Agency (SHRA), on behalf of the Housing Authority of the City of Sacramento (HACS), is soliciting for an experienced affordable housing Developer to develop single family homes on ten (10) SHRA-owned vacant residential parcels within the Oak Park community.  The ten (10) parcels are divided into two (2) groupings of five (5) and proposal can include 1 set of 5 or all 10.  The objective of this Request for Proposals (RFP) is to provide new homeownership opportunities to qualified low-income households through the solicitation of purchase offers for the 10 vacant residential parcels."

For more information, visit: https://acquisition.gov/FAR-Case-2019-009/889_Part_B Offerors are advised that all Shell work associated with delivering the Tenant Improvements are at the Lessor?s cost.? Please refer to Section 3?(Construction Standards and Shell Components)?and specifically to Paragraph 3.07?(Building Shell Requirements)?of the?AAAP RLP Attachment #2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP ) for more detail.? Tenant Improvement Components are detailed under Section 5 of the? AAAP RLP Attachment?#2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP) .? ? It is highly recommended that offerors start the SAM registration process directly following the offer submission.? Refer to RLP Clause 3.06, Item 7. (If applicable) The Government intends to award a Lease to an Offeror of a Building that is in compliance with Seismic Standards. Section 2.03 of the Request for Lease Proposals (RLP) outlines compliance activities required for all leases in moderate or high seismic zones. To determine if your property lies in a moderate or high zone, please reference the map and documents on our website.? HOW TO OFFER: The Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP), located at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap, will enable interested parties to offer space for lease to the Federal Government in response to RLP 22-REGXX.? In addition, the Government will use its AAAP to satisfy the above space requirement. Offerors must go to the AAAP website, select the ?Register to Offer Space? link and follow the instructions to register.? Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the AAAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the AAAP website. Once registered, interested parties may enter offers during any ?Open Period?. For technical assistance with AAAP, email LOP.help@gsa.gov. The Open Period is the 1st through the 7th of each month, ending at 7:30 p.m. (ET) unless otherwise stated by the Government and unless the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday. If the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday, the Open Period will end at 7:30 PM (ET) on the next business day. Refer to AAAP RLP paragraph 3.02.A for more details on the offer submission process. The Government reserves the right to allow for multiple Open Periods prior to selecting an offer for award to meet this specific space requirement.? Offers cannot be submitted during the Closed Period and will not be considered for projects executed during that time period. Lease award will be made to the lowest price, technically acceptable offer, without negotiations, based upon the requirements in this advertisement and in the RLP requirements package found on the AAAP website.? During an Open Period, offerors will be permitted to submit new offers or modify existing offers.? Offerors can draft an offer at any time; however, you can only submit an offer during the Open Period. The offered space must comply with the requirements in this advertisement and the RLP and must meet Federal Government, State, and Local jurisdiction requirements, including requirements for fire and life safety, security, accessibility, seismic, energy, and sustainability standards in accordance with the terms of the Lease.? The Lease and all documents that constitute the Lease package can be found at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap. ?If you have previously submitted an offer in FY 2021, the AAAP application has a copy feature which will allow existing offers to be copied over to the FY 2022 RLP in order to avoid having to re-enter all of the data manually. Please be sure to review FY22 AAAP RLP Package and each page within the AAAP Application prior to submitting your offer as some of the questions have changed. You must re-enter your space and rates on the ?Space and Rates? tab in the AAAP. Your previous offered space will not be copied."

In case if it exceeds 12? then the lessor will provide at their own expense all provisions to meet sound insulation of intended interview rooms, conference rooms and offices. 3. Facility must be within 1/5 mile walking distance from a public transportation. 4. Facility must be within 1/5 walking distance from variety of commercial food service facilities. 5. IDF closet shall receive cooling at all times (24 hrs a day, 365 days a year) for purposes of cooling the designated server room. The peak BTU output of this room is established as 15k BTU per hour. The temperature of this room shall be maintained at 68 degrees F, with humidity control not to exceed 60% relative humidity, regardless of outside temperature or seasonal changes. 6. IDF closet must be in a secure space. 7. If proposed facility is located on other than Ground Floor then there must be a freight elevator and/or back-up elevator inside the building lobby. 8. column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,CO,United States Department Of Agriculture seeks to lease the following space in Hugo and Limon (Lincoln County) CO,Federal,,Department of Agriculture,"Jul 22, 2022",Department of Agriculture,https://sam.gov/opp/381afedfe77148598aeea61275d16b78/view,"57-08073-21-FA
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,louis.zolotor@usda.gov,,"The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) seeks to lease the following space: City, State: Hugo and Limon CO County: Lincoln Delineated Area: (See attached map for reference) N:?City Limits of Hugo and Limon CO E:?City Limits of Hugo and Limon CO S:?City Limits of Hugo and Limon CO W:?City Limits of Hugo and Limon CO Minimum and Maximum Usable Square Feet (ABOA): 2,698 minimum ABOA SF to 2,833 ABOA SF Rentable Square Feet (RSF): Up to 3,238 RSF Space Type: Office and Related Space Reserved Parking Spaces for Government Vehicles: 3 Additional Parking Spaces (available for use at no charge to the Government): 18 Full Term: Up to 10 (10) Years[CC-FRN2]? Firm Term: Three (3) Years Termination Rights: 120 days in whole or in part, after the Firm Term Additional Requirements: The Government wishes to lease space in an existing building, or in a building to be constructed for the Government?s use. Offered space must meet Government requirements for fire safety, accessibility, seismic and sustainability standards per the terms of the Lease.? The space offered, its location, and its surroundings must be compatible with the Government?s intended use. A fully serviced lease?is?required.? Offered space and sites shall not be in the?100-year flood plain. Additional parking spaces may be located on-site and/or within 1/4 of a mile of the premises, pedestrian accessible[CC-FRN3]?. Preferred first floor, contiguous space that meets accessibility requirements. Need fenced parking for 3 GOVs and 1 ATV on trailer Expressions of Interest Due: 7/12/21 Market Survey Date (Estimated): One (1) month after Expressions of Interest received Lease Award Date (Estimated): Ten (10) months after Expressions of Interest received Expressions of Interest shall include the following: 1.???? If existing building, building name and address, and location of the available space within the Building, along with building site/ lot plans, interior layout drawings/pictures (with dimensions shown) reflecting the Space that is being offered. 2.???? If new construction, site/aerial plans or building site/lot plans showing the location of the proposal land, along with the parcel number (if part of multiple parcels, all parcel numbers associated with the proposed land).? Adjacent streets showing proposed ingress/egress shall be shown on the plans. 3.???? Rentable square feet (RSF) and ANSI/BOMA office area (ABOA) square feet to be offered. 4.???? Date of space availability. 5.???? Building or Site Ownership Information.? If offeror is not owner, authorization to show property will be required.* 6.???? Amount of parking available on-site.? 7. ??? If existing building, and if the space submitted does not meet the square footage requirements in this advertisement, whether the building or space submitted can be expanded to meet those requirements. 8. ??? Photos of the space or site being submitted, or permission for Market Survey participants to photograph the space or site. 9.???? For existing buildings, provide information on condition of building systems (roof, HVAC, electrical, plumbing, facade etc.).? Alternatively, provide a copy of a recent commercial building inspection or appraisal. * Any submission received without documentation of ownership and/or written authorization to represent owner(s) will not be considered until such time the documentation has been received.? This documentation must be received on or before the due date for Expressions of Interest.?In cases where an agent is representing multiple entities, written acknowledgement/ permission from each entity to represent multiple interest parties for the same submission must be submitted prior to the Expressions of Interest due date. To submit an offer in response to a Request for Lease Proposals (RLP), if an RLP is issued for this project, the offeror must be registered and active in the System for Award Management (SAM) at SAM.gov.? This registration is not required to respond to this advertisement, but SAM registration will be a minimum requirement to submit a formal proposal in response to the RLP.? It is strongly recommended that potential offerors register, verify, and/or renew their SAM registration on SAM.gov as soon as possible. Send Expressions of Interest to: Name/Title: Louis Zolotor, Realty Specialist Email Address: louis.zolotor@usda.gov Government Contact: Lease Contracting Officer: Louis Zolotor, Lease Contracting Officer Notice: This is not a solicitation for offers, nor is it a request for proposals. The Government will not pay for any costs incurred as a result of this advertisement. Respondents are advised that the Government assumes no responsibility to award a lease based upon responses to this advertisement."

column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,CO,Development of Real Property,State/Local,,"Regional Transportation District, Colorado","Jul 1, 2022","Regional Transportation District, Colorado",https://www.rtd-denver.com/business-center/current-solicitations,"122DH007
column3: ",Regional Transportation District,,303-299-2224,,,"Request for Qualifications (RFQ) No. 122DH012 is seeking qualification statements from qualified firms to provide Development of Real Property Located at 3800 Wynkoop Street, Denver, Colorado. Due to COVID-19 Social Distancing requirements, the Pre-proposal Briefing will be held April 22, 2022 at 10:00 a.m. via Microsoft Teams. Qualification statements will only be accepted electronically via email by Contracting and Procurement, RTD, eva.boyd@rtd-denver.com until 2:00 p.m. prevailing local time on July 1, 2022. No paper Qualification statements will be accepted."

column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,robert.fanning@gsa.gov,,"This advertisement is hereby incorporated into the RLP 22-REG00 by way of reference as an RLP attachment. U.S. GOVERNMENT seeks to lease the following office space through the Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP): City: Wilmington State: DE? Delineated Area:? N: W and E 11th?Street E: N Church Street S: E Front Street to MLK Boulevard W: N Adams Street? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? Minimum ABOA Sq. Ft.: 5,093 Maximum ABOA Sq. Ft.: 5,340 Space Type: Office? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? Term*: 10 years/5 firm????? Amortization Term: 5 years for both Tenant Improvements?and Building Specific Amortized Capital??? *Offerors are encouraged to submit rates for all terms available in the AAAP for consideration against future GSA requirements. Agency Unique Requirements:????? 1. Agency Tenant Improvement Allowance:?????????????? Existing leased space:? ? ? ?N/A per ABOA SF Other locations offered:? ? ? $60.72 per ABOA SF 2. Building Specific Amortized Capital (BSAC)? ? ? ? Existing leased space:? ? ? ? N/A per ABOA SF Other locations offered: ? ? ? $12.00 per ABOA SF ""The Government anticipates that the Tenant Improvement buildout for this requirement may exceed the allowance by approximately $130.15 per ABOA SF. The Government will use the TI Allowance as stated above in evaluating the TI rent component of offers; however, this does not preclude the Government from consideration of move-related replications costs in the evaluation, as outlined under RLP 22-REG00 Paragraph 4.04 ?Present Value Price Evaluation (AAAP Variation).? The disclosure of this potential overage is not intended to be construed as an estimate of move-related replications costs. Also, it is not intended to serve as either an accurate estimate or an agreement by the Government as to the final pricing of the TI work, nor is it a commitment by the Government as to the level of TI work that eventually will be required. This disclosure is only intended to assist Offerors in understanding their potential obligation with respect to financing the full amount of Tenant improvements, as outlined under the Lease Paragraph 1.06 ?Tenant Improvement Rental Adjustment (AAAP Variation).???? 3. Contiguous, above-ground space is required.? 4. For effective space utilization, a minimum of 30' (on-center) between structural elements (columns, core, curtain wall, etc.) is required. Additionally, for the efficiency of layout, the following cannot be considered:? a. Narrow column spacing; b. Atriums, light wells, or other areas interrupting contiguous spaces; c. Extremely long, narrow runs of space; d. Irregular space configurations; or e. Other unusual building features. Any other configuration must be approved by the GSA Lease Contracting Officer and Agency.? 5. Rest rooms shall not be located within Agency tenant space. 6. Parking.? Twelve (12) reserved parking spaces are required for Government Owned Vehicles (GOVs), secured, and with key card / gate access.? Parking should be located within 1,320 walkable linear feet of the offered building closest public or employee entrance to the garage's closest street entrance.??? ? 7. Agency normal hours of operation are 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., Monday ? Friday.?? 8. Where a Criminal Investigation Division (CI) is housed, a radio antenna is required.? The Government may provide, install, and maintain a 10-15 foot high, approximately 20 lb., cell-wave wand roof-mounted transmitting antenna, including cable run from roof to CI interior location.? The offeror shall provide a location for the antenna.? The GSA Contracting Officer and the IRS must approve the location of the antenna. See GSA lease for additional, related requirements. 9. Offered buildings/properties are subject to risk/vulnerability assessment by the Tenant?s Physical Security Unit (PSU) for security reasons, and if deemed unacceptable as a result, the building will be deemed not acceptable.? 10.? In order to demonstrate compliance with meeting the floodplain requirement outlined in Paragraph 2.02 of? the RLP (R100), the offeror shall upload a site plan clearly demarking the offered property in salesforce during the open period. Select the attachment type as Floorplan and upload the document as Site Plan. This plan is required in order to consider the offer if the building is within the 100 year floodplain. 11.? Ceiling Height: Ceiling height is required at a minimum of 8?6? throughout the offered space and sufficient space above the ceiling for independent HVAC units, ducting, cable trays, or other necessary devices. _____________________________________________________________ IMPORTANT NOTES: Offerors are advised to familiarize themselves with the telecommunications prohibitions outlined under Section 889 of the FY19 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), as implemented by Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). For more information, visit: https://acquisition.gov/FAR-Case-2019-009/889_Part_B Offerors are advised that all Shell work associated with delivering the Tenant Improvements are at the Lessor?s cost.? Please refer to Section 3?(Construction Standards and Shell Components)?and specifically to Paragraph 3.07?(Building Shell Requirements)?of the?AAAP RLP Attachment #2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP) for more detail.? Tenant Improvement Components are detailed under Section 5 of the?AAAP RLP Attachment?#2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP).? ? It is highly recommended that offerors start the SAM registration process directly following the offer submission.? Refer to RLP Clause 3.06, Item 7. HOW TO OFFER:? In addition, the Government will use its AAAP to satisfy the above space requirement.? Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the AAAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the AAAP website. Once registered, interested parties may enter offers during any ?Open Period?. For technical assistance with AAAP, email LOP.help@gsa.gov.? The Open Period is the 1st through the 7th of each month, ending at 7:30 p.m. (ET) unless otherwise stated by the Government and unless the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday. If the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday, the Open Period will end at 7:30 PM (ET) on the next business day. Refer to AAAP RLP paragraph 3.02.A for more details on the offer submission process. The Government reserves the right to allow for multiple Open Periods prior to selecting an offer for award to meet this specific space requirement.? Lease award will be made to the lowest price, technically acceptable offer, without negotiations, based upon the requirements in this advertisement and in the RLP requirements package found on the AAAP website.? Lease award will be made to the lowest price, technically acceptable offer, without negotiations, based upon the requirements in this advertisement and in the RLP requirements package found on the AAAP website.? During an Open Period, offerors will be permitted to submit new offers or modify existing offers.? Offerors can draft an offer at any time; however, you can only submit an offer during the Open Period. The offered space must comply with the requirements in this advertisement and the RLP and must meet Federal Government, State, and Local jurisdiction requirements, including requirements for fire and life safety, security, accessibility, seismic, energy, and sustainability standards in accordance with the terms of the Lease.? The Lease and all documents that constitute the Lease package can be found at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap. ?If you have previously submitted an offer in FY 2021, the AAAP application has a copy feature which will allow existing offers to be copied over to the FY 2022 RLP in order to avoid having to re-enter all of the data manually. Please be sure to review FY22 AAAP RLP Package and each page within the AAAP Application prior to submitting your offer as some of the questions have changed. You must re-enter your space and rates on the ?Space and Rates? tab in the AAAP. Your previous offered space will not be copied."

column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,DE,Lease of Office Space within Region 3. Request for Lease Proposals (RLP) #22-REG03 - OFFICE SPACE,Federal,,General Services Administration,"Jun 7, 2022",General Services Administration,https://sam.gov/opp/8a09dd2b51414e8193aadd7019eb396e/view,"22-REG03_1DE2030
column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,robert.fanning@gsa.gov,,"This advertisement is hereby incorporated into the RLP 22-REG03 by way of reference as an RLP attachment. U.S. GOVERNMENT seeks to lease the following office space through the Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP): City: Wilmington State: DE? Delineated Area:? N: W and E 11th?Street E: N Church Street S: E Front Street to MLK Boulevard W: N Adams Street? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? Minimum ABOA Sq. Ft.: 5,093 Maximum ABOA Sq. Ft.: 5,340 Space Type: Office? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? Term*: 15 years/13 firm????? Amortization Term: 8 years for both Tenant Improvements?and Building Specific Amortized Capital??? *Offerors are encouraged to submit rates for all terms available in the AAAP for consideration against future GSA requirements. Agency Unique Requirements:????? 1. Agency Tenant Improvement Allowance:?????????????? Existing leased space: ? ? ? $______ per ABOA SF Other locations offered:? ? ? $60.72 per ABOA SF 2. Building Specific Amortized Capital (BSAC)? ? ? ? Existing leased space:? ? ? ? $______ per ABOA SF Other locations offered: ? ? ? $12.00 per ABOA SF ""The Government anticipates that the Tenant Improvement buildout for this requirement may exceed the allowance by approximately $130.15 per ABOA SF. The Government will use the TI Allowance as stated above in evaluating the TI rent component of offers; however, this does not preclude the Government from consideration of move-related replications costs in the evaluation, as outlined under RLP 22-REG03 Paragraph 4.04 ?Present Value Price Evaluation (AAAP Variation).? The disclosure of this potential overage is not intended to be construed as an estimate of move-related replications costs. Also, it is not intended to serve as either an accurate estimate or an agreement by the Government as to the final pricing of the TI work, nor is it a commitment by the Government as to the level of TI work that eventually will be required. This disclosure is only intended to assist Offerors in understanding their potential obligation with respect to financing the full amount of Tenant improvements, as outlined under the Lease Paragraph 1.06 ?Tenant Improvement Rental Adjustment (AAAP Variation).???? 3. Contiguous, above-ground space is required.? 4. For effective space utilization, a minimum of 30' (on-center) between structural elements (columns, core, curtain wall, etc.) is required. Additionally, for the efficiency of layout, the following cannot be considered:? a. Narrow column spacing; b. Atriums, light wells, or other areas interrupting contiguous spaces; c. Extremely long, narrow runs of space; d. Irregular space configurations; or e. Other unusual building features. Any other configuration must be approved by the GSA Lease Contracting Officer and Agency.? 5. Rest rooms shall not be located within Agency tenant space. 6. Parking.? Twelve (12) reserved parking spaces are required for Government Owned Vehicles (GOVs), secured, and with key card / gate access.? Parking should be located within 1,320 walkable linear feet of the offered building closest public or employee entrance to the garage's closest street entrance.??? ? 7. Agency normal hours of operation are 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., Monday ? Friday.?? 8. Where a Criminal Investigation Division (CI) is housed, a radio antenna is required.? The Government may provide, install, and maintain a 10-15 foot high, approximately 20 lb., cell-wave wand roof-mounted transmitting antenna, including cable run from roof to CI interior location.? The offeror shall provide a location for the antenna.? The GSA Contracting Officer and the IRS must approve the location of the antenna. See GSA lease for additional, related requirements. 9. Offered buildings/properties are subject to risk/vulnerability assessment by the Tenant?s Physical Security Unit (PSU) for security reasons, and if deemed unacceptable as a result, the building will be deemed not acceptable.? 10.? In order to demonstrate compliance with meeting the floodplain requirement outlined in Paragraph 2.02 of? the RLP (R100), the offeror shall upload a site plan clearly demarking the offered property in salesforce during the open period. Select the attachment type as Floorplan and upload the document as Site Plan. This plan is required in order to consider the offer if the building is within the 100 year floodplain. 11.? Ceiling Height: Ceiling height is required at a minimum of 8?6? throughout the offered space and sufficient space above the ceiling for independent HVAC units, ducting, cable trays, or other necessary devices. _____________________________________________________________ IMPORTANT NOTES: Offerors are advised to familiarize themselves with the telecommunications prohibitions outlined under Section 889 of the FY19 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), as implemented by Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). For more information, visit: https://acquisition.gov/FAR-Case-2019-009/889_Part_B Offerors are advised that all Shell work associated with delivering the Tenant Improvements are at the Lessor?s cost.? Please refer to Section 3?(Construction Standards and Shell Components)?and specifically to Paragraph 3.07?(Building Shell Requirements)?of the?AAAP RLP Attachment #2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP) for more detail.? Tenant Improvement Components are detailed under Section 5 of the?AAAP RLP Attachment?#2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP).? ? It is highly recommended that offerors start the SAM registration process directly following the offer submission.? Refer to RLP Clause 3.06, Item 7. HOW TO OFFER:? The Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP), located at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap, will enable interested parties to offer space for lease to the Federal Government in response to RLP 22-REG03.? In addition, the Government will use its AAAP to satisfy the above space requirement.? Offerors must go to the AAAP website, select the ?Register to Offer Space? link and follow the instructions to register.? Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the AAAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the AAAP website. Once registered, interested parties may enter offers during any ?Open Period?. For technical assistance with AAAP, email LOP.help@gsa.gov.? The Open Period is the 1st through the 7th of each month, ending at 7:30 p.m. (ET) unless otherwise stated by the Government and unless the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday. If the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday, the Open Period will end at 7:30 PM (ET) on the next business day. Refer to AAAP RLP paragraph 3.02.A for more details on the offer submission process. The Government reserves the right to allow for multiple Open Periods prior to selecting an offer for award to meet this specific space requirement.? Offers cannot be submitted during the Closed Period and will not be considered for projects executed during that time period. Lease award will be made to the lowest price, technically acceptable offer, without negotiations, based upon the requirements in this advertisement and in the RLP requirements package found on the AAAP website.? During an Open Period, offerors will be permitted to submit new offers or modify existing offers.? Offerors can draft an offer at any time; however, you can only submit an offer during the Open Period. The offered space must comply with the requirements in this advertisement and the RLP and must meet Federal Government, State, and Local jurisdiction requirements, including requirements for fire and life safety, security, accessibility, seismic, energy, and sustainability standards in accordance with the terms of the Lease.? The Lease and all documents that constitute the Lease package can be found at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap. ?If you have previously submitted an offer in FY 2021, the AAAP application has a copy feature which will allow existing offers to be copied over to the FY 2022 RLP in order to avoid having to re-enter all of the data manually. Please be sure to review FY22 AAAP RLP Package and each page within the AAAP Application prior to submitting your offer as some of the questions have changed. You must re-enter your space and rates on the ?Space and Rates? tab in the AAAP. Your previous offered space will not be copied."

column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,FL,"X1GZ--New Lease: Old Carolina Warehouse 29,000 NUSF of Warehouse space in Carolina, PR",Federal,,Department of Veterans Affairs,"Jun 7, 2022",Department of Veterans Affairs,https://sam.gov/opp/f11194c34143431eb1f7cc8c0bca2673/view,"36C24822R0133
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,javier.correaochoa@va.gov,,"Expressions of Interest Sought Requirement: The US Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) currently occupies 29,000 contiguous net usable square feet (NUSF) of warehouse and related space in a building under lease in Carolina, Puerto Rico, that will be expiring. The VA intends to Sole-Source a lease to the owner of the building in order to continue occupancy. The lease term requirement is for a term of three (3) Years. The space must be available for occupancy by September 1, 2022. Space within or fronting on the following boundaries will be considered: North: Ocean South: Highway 199 & 861 East: Highway 188 West: Highway 693& 165 The Government is considering alternative space if economically advantageous. The Government will use the information it receives in response to this advertisement as a basis to develop a cost-benefit analysis and to determine whether to compete the lease requirement or to remain at its current location. In making this determination, the Government will consider, among other things, the availability of alternate space that potentially can satisfy the Government's requirements, as well as costs likely to be incurred through relocating, such as physical move costs, replication of tenant improvements and telecommunications infrastructure, and non-productive agency downtime. Please send expressions of interest to Javier Correa-Ochoa no later than 3:00 PM ET on June 7, 2022, to the following e-mail: javier.correaochoa@va.gov Expressions of Interest must include the following information: Building name and address and location of the available space within the building Rentable square feet available and expected rental rate per rentable square foot, fully serviced ANSI/BOMA Office area square feet (ABOA) to be offered and expected rental rate per usable square foot, fully serviced. Indicate whether or not the quoted rental rate includes an amount for tenant improvements and state the amount, if any. Date of space availability. Method of rentable space measurement Building ownership information Amount of parking available on-site and its cost. Include whether expected rental rate includes the cost of the required Government parking (if any). Energy efficiency and renewable energy features existing within the building. List of building services provided. The Government is considering space if economically advantageous. The Government is limited by law (40 USC 278a, as Amended 10-1-81) to pay no more than the appraised fair rental value for space. The Government's decision regarding whether to relocate will be based, in part, on information received in response to this advertisement Please note: This advertisement is not a solicitation for offers, nor is it a request for proposals. A solicitation for offers may be issued by the Department of Veterans Affairs at a later date."

Consulting: Education, Training, Testing, Leadership Bids,AZ,U008--Geriatric Annual CME Course,Federal,,Department of Veterans Affairs,"Jun 27, 2022",Department of Veterans Affairs,https://sam.gov/opp/bacf592c67e1429f98dddbf0c2fcc0a0/view,"36C26222Q1020
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,Alfreda.Hunter@va.gov,,"NOTICE OF INTENT TO SOLE SOURCE Page 3 of 3 Page 3 of 3 SUBJECT* 691-22-4-4361-0101 STANDARD Precedence NEW Reqmnt TUITION for 94x CliniciansCOR@Sta.691 - Shawn CLARKE  GENERAL INFORMATION CONTRACTING OFFICE S ZIP CODE* 90815 SOLICITATION NUMBER* 36C26222Q1020 ARCHIVE 30 DAYS AFTER THE RESPONSE DATE RECOVERY ACT FUNDS N PRODUCT SERVICE CODE* U008 NAICS CODE* 611310 CONTRACTING OFFICE ADDRESS Department of Veterans Affairs Network Contracting Office 22 4811 Airport Plaza Drive Suite 600 Long Beach CA 90815 POINT OF CONTACT* Contract Specialist Alfreda Hunter Alfreda.hunter@va.gov 310-617-8271 ADDITIONAL INFORMATION AGENCY S URL URL DESCRIPTION AGENCY CONTACT S EMAIL ADDRESS EMAIL DESCRIPTION DESCRIPTION The Department of Veterans Affairs, Network Contracting Office (NCO) 22, located at 4811 Airport Plaza Drive, Long Beach, CA 90815 is issuing this Notice of Intent (NOI) to inform industry contractors of the Government s intent to execute a Sole Source Award under FAR Part 13 Simplified Acquisition Procedures (SAP) This procurement is being conducted using commercial item procedures pursuant to FAR Part 12 and FAR Part 13, specifically FAR Subpart13.106-1(b)(1)(i) allowing the Contracting Officer (CO) to solicit from one source. This will be a Firm Fixed Price (FFP) award and an anticipated award date is set for June 8, 2022. The intended Contractor is the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, The Brookdale Department of Geriatrics and Palliative Medicine, Box 1070, One Gustave L. Levy Place, York, New York 10029. The Contractor shall provide an external academic event for the VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System department of VA Geriatric Research Education Clinical Center (GRECC). The proposed period of performance shall be from September 20, 2022 through September 23, 2022. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) for this requirement is, 611310 Colleges, Universities, And Professional Schools. The Product Service Code for this requirement is U008 Education/Training-Training/Curriculum Development. The estimated value of this contract is $112,330.00. This notice of intent is neither a formal solicitation nor a request for competitive proposals. No solicitation document is available and telephone requests will not be honored. Any response to this notice must be received by June 7, 2022 and show clear, compelling and convincing evidence that competition will be advantageous to the Government. The intent of this synopsis is for informational purposes only. Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. A determination by the Government not to compete this action based on this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. All inquiries and concerns must be addressed in writing via e-mail to Alfreda.hunter@va.gov."

Consulting: Education, Training, Testing, Leadership Bids,AZ,Intent to Sole source - Sargent Hydraulic Control Valve Maintenance Training,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 10, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/a3e6b8130c98420c8dbae90dfeab603a/view,"N4523A22Q1337
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,patrick.j.scott2@navy.mil,,"THIS NOTICE OF INTENT IS NOT A REQUEST FOR QUOTES. A DETERMINATION NOT TO COMPETE THE PROPOSED PROCUREMENT BASED UPON RESPONSES TO THIS NOTICE IS SOLELY WITHIN THE DISCRETION OF THE GOVERNMENT. The Puget Sound Naval Shipyard and Intermediate Maintenance Facility (PSNS) Contracting Office (Code 440), hereby provides notice of its intent to award a sole-source, firm fixed contract, to Sargent Aerospace and Defense. The contract is expected to be awarded under FAR 13.106-1 (b). A Justification and Approval for Other Than Full and Open Competition has been prepared. The period of performance shall be one week. This is a non-personnel services contract to Procure Sargent Hydraulic Control Valve maintenance training. Sargent Aerospace and defense is the only sole source to provide training for TRIDENT Refit Facility, Bangor (TRFB). In accordance with (IAW) standing Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA) and Department of Defense (DOD) guidance, directs all maintenance technicians and mechanics will be trained to work on the equipment under their cognizance. TRFB has a standing requirement to conduct repairs and maintenance on Sargent Hydraulic Control Valves as most hydraulic system on submarines and surface ships have these control valves. As Sargent is the manufacuture of the valve, they are the only one who are authorized to provide the necessary training required. NAICS, 611430 - Professional and Management Development Training Business size standard of $12,000,000.00. U008 Education/Training ? Training/Curriculum Development. THIS NOTICE OF INTENT IS NOT A REQUEST FOR COMPETITIVE QUOTES. No solicitation or RFQ will be forthcoming. However, interested parties may identify their interest, a quote, and capabilities to respond to this requirement no later than JUNE 10, 2022 9AM, Pacific Time. Interested parties are encouraged to furnish information by email only with subject line stating - RESPONSE TO INTENT TO SOLE SOURCE FOR N4523A22Q1337. A determination not to compete this requirement, based upon responses to this notice, is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will normally be considered solely for determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. PSNS and IMF Contracting Office (Code 440) will NOT be responsible for any costs incurred by interested parties in responding to this notice of intent. Only written responses will be considered. All responses from responsible sources will be fully considered. As a result of analyzing responses to this notice of intent, the Government shall determine if a solicitation will be issued. Any prospective contractor must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) in order to be eligible for award. All documents submitted will not be returned. All interested parties shall submit clear and convincing documentation demonstrating their capabilities to satisfy the requirements listed above to Purchasing Agent, Patrick Scott by email at patrick.j.scott2@navy.mil and Contracting Officer, Nickson Hatungimana at Nickson.Hatungimana@navy.mil . The capability documentation should include general information and technical background describing in detail the prospective contractor's capabilities and experience that will demonstrate the ability to support these requirements."

column1: Consulting: Education, Training, Testing, Leadership Bids,CA,RFP for Technical Advisory Committee Facilitator,State/Local,,"San Francisco County, California","Jun 14, 2022","San Francisco County, California",https://sfcitypartner.sfgov.org/pages/Events-BS3/event-search.aspx,"0000007003
column3: ",Purchasing,,415-554-6743,,,"This Request for Proposals (hereinafter “RFP” or “Solicitation”) is being issued by Department of the Environment (hereinafter, “SF Environment” or “City”). SF Environment is seeking qualified suppliers (“Proposers”) to provide proposals for the administration and facilitation of Technical Advisory Committee (TAC) meetings (Proposal).

column1: SF Environment creates visionary policies and innovative programs that promote social equity, protect human health, and lead the way toward a sustainable future. We put our mission into action by mobilizing communities and providing the resources needed to safeguard our homes, our city, and ultimately our planet. SF Environment does this by developing innovative, practical and wide-ranging environmental programs, fostering groundbreaking legislation, and educating the public by providing comprehensive and easily accessible information on a wide range of sustainable practices.

SF Environment’s Clean Transportation team is establishing a new Medium- and Heavy-Duty (“MD/HD”) Zero Emission Vehicle (“ZEV”) Technical Advisory Committee (“TAC”). The TAC will bring together public sector stakeholders, utilities, City departments, community-based organizations, local businesses, and fleet representatives directly engaged in MD/HD fleet electrification in San Francisco to guide the development of the San Francisco MD/HD ZEV Blueprint. The TAC will provide a forum for coordination and collaboration to ensure that stakeholders can inform and review key Blueprint components.

column2: Provide an opportunity for all members to aid in the design, development, and review of the Blueprint components and final Blueprint;
Discuss challenges to fleet electrification and the impacts of charging siting and installation on the community;
Share data, best-practices, and messaging to develop cohesive solutions that support the Blueprint’s goals; and
Provide oversight to ensure that the resulting Blueprint and its contents fulfill their needs, address their concerns and interests, and are implementable within the allocated timeframe.

column1: SF Environment is looking for a contractor with experience in facilitating in-person and virtual stakeholder meetings in a professional, inclusive, and collaborative manner. The TAC meeting facilitator will design and facilitate TAC meetings, with the purpose of moving TAC members towards a common goal. The facilitator will foster collaboration and teamwork and manage conflict among members. The facilitator will coordinate, lead, and support all phases of team meetings to ensure progression and completion of work as well as supports the SF Environment project lead, and is accountable for the quality, timeliness, and effectiveness of TAC meetings. Having a neutral, third-party facilitator is important to the success of the meetings because a facilitator will provide a structured, inclusive space for group members to be productive, creative, and efficient.

A contract awarded pursuant to this Solicitation shall be non-exclusive with an original term of two (2) years. The City at its sole, absolute discretion, shall have the option to extend the term for one (1) additional year for a total of three (3) years.

A contract awarded pursuant to this Solicitation shall have a not to exceed (“NTE”) amount of up to $20,000 for the initial two (2) year term. Should the contract be extended, the NTE may be increased by up to $10,000 for a NTE amount of up to $30,000.

column3: ",Purchasing,,415-554-6743,,,"This Request for Proposals (hereinafter “RFP” or “Solicitation”) is being issued by Department of the Environment (hereinafter, “SF Environment” or “City”). SF Environment, on behalf of all City Departments, is seeking qualified suppliers (“Proposers”) to provide proposals for professional services in culturally relevant, multilingual community outreach.(Proposal).

column1: The San Francisco Department of the Environment (SF Environment) advances climate protection and enhances quality of life for all San Franciscans. SF Environment is a department within the City and County of San Francisco, a local government committed to innovation, leadership and collaboration in creating environmental change.? SF Environment is recognized worldwide for its environmental policies and programs, which center on achieving zero waste, reducing toxic chemical hazards, advancing environmental justice, promoting low-carbon transportation modes, expanding clean energy infrastructure, greening the city’s built environment and protecting its urban forest. SF Environment serves primary audiences consisting of San Francisco residents, businesses, and workers by providing comprehensive and easily accessible information on a wide range of environmental programs, services, and City policies.

SF Environment is seeking highly qualified proposers with experience in culturally relevant, multilingual community outreach to provide contract services on an as-needed basis. The Department expects to award more than one contract. The contractors will work with SF Environment project managers in developing the specific tasks, and upon approval by the Communications & Community Engagement Program Manager, the contractors will be responsible for producing the final product.
The City shall award a contract to the two (2) Proposers that meet the Minimum Qualifications of this Solicitation and obtain the highest-ranking scores.

A contract awarded pursuant to this Solicitation shall be non-exclusive with an original term of up to three (3) years. The City at its sole, absolute discretion, shall have the option to extend the term to a total of up to five (5) years.
Each contract awarded pursuant to this Solicitation shall have a not to exceed (“NTE”) amount of up to $100,000 per year with a maximum of up to $500,000 for the full term.

column1: Consulting: Education, Training, Testing, Leadership Bids,CO,Combined Synopsis/Solicitation United States Space Force (USSF) In-residence Intermediate Developmental Education (IDE) and Senior Developmental Education (SDE),Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 16, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/eba2eb2bfb424d5cba556ad369b85358/view,"FA251822R0017
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,alexander.rust.2@spaceforce.mil,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. The provision at FAR 52.212-1, Instructions for Offerors - Commercial Items applies to this acquisition. The following is an addenda to FAR 52.212-1. Additionally, clauses 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items and 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders- Commercial Items apply to this requirement. SAM-D/PKA intends to award a Firm Fixed Price (FFP) type contract for the purchase of graduate education services as described in the Statement of Objectives (SOO) (Attachment 1). The Government intends to award one contract to the responsible offeror whose offer represents the Best Value to the Government. The offeror's proposal must include all data and information requested by this instruction to offerors (ITO) and must be submitted in accordance with these instructions. The offer shall be compliant with the requirements as stated in Attachment 1 - GECS SOO. The proposal shall be clear, concise, and shall include sufficient detail for effective evaluation and for substantiating the validity of stated claims. The proposal should not simply rephrase or restate the Government's requirements but rather shall provide convincing rationale to address how the offeror intends to meet these requirements. Offerors shall assume that the Government has no prior knowledge of their systems and experience and will base its evaluation on the information presented in the offeror's proposal. Elaborate brochures or documentation, binding, detailed art work, or other embellishments are unnecessary and are not desired. This document and incorporated clauses and provisions are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. This requirement is being solicited as full and open competition. The NAICS code for this acquisition is 611310 and the Small Business size standard is $30.5M. All clauses and provisions may be found in full text at the following site: https://www.acquisition.gov."

column1: Consulting: Education, Training, Testing, Leadership Bids,GA,"Certified StrongBonds Training Course with Love Languages, Robins AFB, GA",Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 7, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/ef895a39eb174429a4f0818faa5120b8/view,"FA8501-STRONGBONDSCE
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,alex.weichold@us.af.mil,,"Request for Information (RFI)/Sources Sought Certified StrongBonds Training Course with Love Languages, Robins AFB, GA The Government is conducting market research to identify potential sources that possess the capability of providing services encompassing Certified Strong Bonds Training Course with 5 Love Languages for a minimum of ?25 couples (50 people) at CONUS locations. Specific area requiring service is Robins, AFB, Georgia. Headquarters Air Force Reserves, Robins AFB, provides Total Force members support by increasing resilience through developing the knowledge and skills necessary to build strong interpersonal relationships.???? Contractor shall furnish all personnel, material, venue, catering and services required. The contractor is responsible for providing 2ea StrongBonds Training Courses to include: 1ea Certified StrongBonds Trainer certified in Five Love Languages Curriculum, Venue for 50 people, Food consisting of Coffee, Tea, Water, Snacks, 50 ea course materials. Must provide 16 hrs of instruction in Strong Bonds approved 5 Love Languages. Instruction must include identification of students primary love language, the primary love language of at least 1 individual related to the student and skills for applying 5 Love Languages to personal relationships. Must be able to provide seating for 50 people/25 couples in conference style environment. Contractors/Institutions responding to this market research are placed on notice that participation in this survey may not ensure participation in future solicitations or contract awards. The government will not reimburse participants for any expenses associated with their participation in this survey. This solicitation (request for information) is issued for the purpose of market research to identify potential sources. .INSTRUCTIONS: This RFI contains a description below of the specialized training required and a Contractor Capability Survey is attached, which allows you to provide your company?s capability. If, after reviewing these documents, you desire to participate in the market research, you should provide documentation that supports your company?s capability in meeting these requirements. Failure to provide documentation may result in the government being unable to adequately assess your capabilities. If you lack sufficient experience in a particular area, please provide details explaining how you would overcome the lack of experience/capabilities in order to perform that portion of the requirement (i.e., teaming, subcontracting, etc.) Identify any areas of work that your organization believes should be broken out exclusively for Small Business. Both large and small businesses are encouraged to participate in this Market Research. Joint ventures or teaming arrangements are encouraged. Questions relative to this market survey should be addressed to the RFI Points of Contact. PURPOSE/DESCRIPTION The Government is conducting market research to identify potential sources that possess the expertise, capabilities, and experience to meet qualification requirements to: The contractor will be required to provide a certified StrongBonds and Five (5) Love Languages trainer, 2ea StrongBonds Training Courses to include: 1ea Certified StrongBonds Trainer certified in Five Love Languages Curriculum; 50 ea course materials; Venue for 50 people; Food consisting of Coffee, Tea, Water, Snacks. Points of Contact E-mail response only please, must be received no later than 5PM ET, 7 JUNE 2022. Please electronically submit your response by email to the following Points of Contact (POC): AFSC/PZIOB Attn: Alex Weichold Alex.Weichold@us.af.mil Melissa Wells Melissa.Wells.5@us.af.mil NOTE: Ensure data is in a readable electronic format. Ensure ?electronic data can be received through a firewall."

This effort will support training mid-career 170A WOAC students (CW2-CW3) for the Army?s Cyber Branch."

Naval Facilities Engineering Systems Command (NAVFAC) Pacific requests responses from qualified sources capable of providing: CLIN 0001 ? Base: BECx Training, Locations: WA/SE/NW/HI CLIN 0002 ? Option: BECx Training, Locations: LANT/EURAFCENT CLIN 0003 ? Option: BECx Training, Locations: ML CLIN 0004 ? Option: BECx Training, Locations: SW CLIN 0005 ? Option: BECx Training, Locations: PAC CLIN 0006 ? Option: BECx Training, Locations: MAR/FE See Statement of Work (SOW) for detailed breakdown. Period of Performance is 01 August 2022 ? 31 July 2023; This requirement has optional CLINs to accommodate additional training locations, the optional CLINs do not extend the term of the contract.? Training classes will be held virtually.? Responsibility and Inspection: unless otherwise specified in the order, the supplier is responsible for the performance of all inspection requirements and quality control. See Attachment 1 for provisions and clauses applicable to this procurement. System for Award Management (SAM): Quoters must be registered in the SAM database to be considered for award.? Registration is free and can be completed online at https://sam.gov/content/entity-registration. All quotes shall include price(s), FOB destination, a point of contact, name and phone number, GSA contract number if applicable, business size, and payment terms.? Each response must clearly indicate the capability of the quoter to meet all specifications and requirements as stated in the SOW.? All quotes shall be submitted to Ms. Vanessa Menor via email at vanessa.l.menor.civ@us.navy.mil. This announcement will close at 1100 hours, Hawaii Standard Time on Thursday, June 16, 2022.?For further questions regarding this announcement, Ms. Menor can be reached by telephone at 808-474-1402 or via email at vanessa.l.menor.civ@us.navy.mil.? All responsible sources, whom submit a quote on or before the closing date and time of this announcement, shall be considered by the agency."
