This is a total small business set aside. ****************************** ?(I)???????? This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice and in accordance with the simplified acquisition procedures authorized in FAR Part 13. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. (II)???????? This solicitation is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ).? Submit written quotes on RFQ Number NF-FT5100-22-01786MWH. (III)??????? The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06 (May 2022) Deviation (2021-06)(Sept 2021). (IV)??????? This solicitation is being issued as a total small business set aside. The associated NAICS code is 611430.? The small business size standard is $12.0M. (V)???????? This combined solicitation/synopsis is for the purchase of the following commercial item(s): Services, Non-Personal, to provide labor, materials and equipment (unless otherwise provided herein) to provide services to enhance employee engagement and senior leadership capacity. Specifically, PIRO seeks contractor support to address identified issues associated with PIRO?s Senior Leadership Board (SLB) members as specified in the attached, incorporated Performance Work Statement (PWS). (VI)??????? Description of requirements is as follows:? Services, Non-Personal, to provide labor, materials and equipment (unless otherwise provided herein) to provide services to enhance employee engagement and senior leadership capacity. Specifically, PIRO seeks contractor support to address identified issues associated with PIRO?s Senior Leadership Board (SLB) members as specified in the attached, incorporated Performance Work Statement (PWS). (VII)????? Date(s) and place(s) of performance and acceptance:? Place of Performance:? Base Year ? tasks 1, 2, 3, and 4 will require some on-site access to meet with staff but the majority of the work will be conducted virtually.? Pacific Islands Regional Office, 1845 Wasp Blvd, Bldg. 176, Honolulu, HI 96818-5007 Option Year - task 5 may be conducted virtually.? Onsite work will be conducted at the Pacific Islands Regional Office, 1845 Wasp Blvd, Bldg. 176, Honolulu, HI 96818-5007. Period of performance:? Base Year:? 12 months from date of award Option Year 1:? 12 month period starting at the end of the base year?????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????? (VIII)? FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors -- Commercial Items (NOV 2021), applies to this acquisition. This is a tradeoff, best value RFQ. NOTICE TO OFFERORS:? Instructions for submitting quotations under this request for quote must be followed.? Failure to provide all information to aid in the evaluation may be considered non-responsive.? Offers that are non-responsive may be excluded from further evaluation and rejected without further notification to the offeror. Enter specific Instructions below 1.? Submit quotations to the office specified in this solicitation at or before the time specified in the solicitation.? Email quotes are acceptable and can be sent to marilyn.herrera@noaa.gov. 2.? Contractor shall have an active registration in the System for Award Management (SAM found at www.SAM.gov) in order to provide a quote and be eligible for award. 3.? Provide all evaluation criteria in accordance with FAR 52.212-2 in this package. ""THE GOVERNMENT DOES NOT ACCEPT RESPONSIBILITY FOR NON-RECEIPT OF QUOTES.? IT IS THE CONTRACTOR'S RESPONSIBILITY TO REQUEST AND RECEIVE A CONFIRMATION OF THE QUOTE RECEIPT"". CAM 1352.215-72 Inquiries (APR 2010) OFFERORS MUST SUBMIT ALL QUESTIONS CONCERNING THIS SOLICITATION IN WRITING TO MARILYN.HERRERA@NOAA.GOV.? QUESTIONS SHOULD BE RECEIVED NO LATER THAN 4:00 P.M. MDT/MST, 06/03/2022.? Any responses to questions will be made in writing, without identification of the questioner, and will be included in an amendment to the solicitation. Even if provided in other form, only the question responses included in the amendment to the solicitation will govern performance of the contract.? (End of clause) ?(IX)? FAR 52.212-2 EVALUATION ? COMMERCIAL ITEMS (NOV 2021), applies to this acquisition.? Offers will be evaluated based on price and the factors set forth in paragraph (a) the Government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible offeror whose offer conforming to the solicitation will be most advantageous to the Government, price and other factors considered. The following factors shall be used to evaluate offers.? All factors have the same value. Paragraph (a) is hereby completed as follows: Evaluation will be based on: ? Technical Approach and Capability.? It is the contractor?s responsibility to provide, with the quote, all necessary documentation and/or information for the Government to make a determination that the contractor is technically capable and acceptable to compete the services as specified in the Performance Work Statement.? ?? Past Performance. The offeror's past performance on related contracts will be evaluated to determine, as appropriate, successful performance of contract requirements, quality and timeliness of delivery of goods and services, cost management, communications between contracting parties, proactive management and customer satisfaction. Provide at least two references of similar projects as well as contact information for those projects, contacts emails and contacts telephone numbers.? Price The Government intends to award a tradeoff, best value, firm fixed price purchase order on an all or none basis with payment terms of Net 30. (b) Options. The Government will evaluate offers for award purposes by adding the total price for all options to the total price for the basic requirement. The Government may determine that an offer is unacceptable if the option prices are significantly unbalanced. Evaluation of options shall not obligate the Government to exercise the option(s). (c) A written notice of award or acceptance of an offer, mailed or otherwise furnished to the successful offeror within the time for acceptance specified in the offer, shall result in a binding contract without further action by either party. Before the offer?s specified expiration time, the Government may accept an offer (or part of an offer), whether or not there are negotiations after its receipt, unless a written notice of withdrawal is received before award. (End of provision)"

column1: Consulting: Education, Training, Testing, Leadership Bids,IN,Diesel/Automotive Repair Technician Program - THX,Federal,,Department of Justice,Today ,Department of Justice,https://sam.gov/opp/e0b1929637604e63aab18a6ecda17630/view,"15BFA022Q00000012
column5: ",Purchasing,,888-REG-FAIR,ldthomas@bop.gov,,"The Federal Bureau of Prisons, Field Acquisition Office, Grand Prairie, TX, intends to issue solicitation 15BFA022Q00000012 for the provision of Diesel/Automotive Repair Technician Program.? The contractor will provide the Diesel/Automotive Repair Technician Program at their designated facility that is no more than 20 miles from the Federal Correctional Complex, FCC Terre Haute located at 4200 Bureau Road North, Terre Haute, Indiana 47808. ?The contract type is an indefinite delivery/requirements contract with firm-fixed unit price. The award will be made to the responsible vendor who submits the lowest quote to the Government. ?The contractor shall provide college accreditation and non-personal instruction for a Diesel/Automotive Repair Technician program to inmates for the period from the effective contract award date through 12 months. The cost estimate is for the one-year contract with an option for four additional contract years. The contractor will be required to develop lesson plans and provide training to inmate workers. The rate for these services shall be on an hourly basis. The work week shall be no more than 30 hours per week. Services will be scheduled during the regular work week (Monday through Friday, excluding federal holidays). The contract shall be for a maximum of 1,410 sessions per year with an estimated total of 10 inmates attending the class per year.? A session is defined as 1 hour in length. Lesson plans will be submitted and approved by the Supervisor of Education and the Facilities Department manager. Training will include live work and instruction, hands-on work, group and individual learning experiences as required. The activities will be performed on a daily basis. ??Please see further details in the attached Statement of Work.? The base period of performance will be from October 1, 2022 to September 30, 2023 with 4 (four) 12-month option years in consecutive order, if exercised, at the Government?s unilateral right with a 6 month option period.? The solicitation will be available on or about May 10, 2022 and will be distributed solely through SAMs website (www.SAM.gov). ?All future information concerning this acquisition, including solicitation amendments, will be distributed solely through this website. Interested parties are responsible for monitoring this site to ensure you have the most up-to-date information about this acquisition. Hard copies of the solicitation will not be available. ?The website provides all downloading instructions to obtain a copy of the solicitation. ?Faith-Based and Community-Based organizations can submit offers/bids/quotations equally with other organizations for contracts for which they are eligible. The anticipated date for receipt of quotes is on or about June 10, 2022. ?No collect calls will be accepted.? No telephone request or written requests for the market survey will be accepted.? All quotes must be submitted via email to ldthomas@bop.gov.? If you have any questions, please send all correspondence to the aforementioned email.? Insert the clause FAR 52.204-13, System for Award Management Maintenance, in solicitations that contain the provision at 52.204-7, and resulting contracts. This clause requires all contractors doing business with the federal government after September 30, 2003, to be registered in the SAM database at www.sam.gov.? If you have any questions, please send all correspondence to the aforementioned email.? Please note: All contractors doing business with the Federal Government must be registered in the System For Award Management (SAM) database. The website for registration is https://www.sam.gov/portal/SAM/#1. The acquisition is unrestricted. The North American Industrial Classification (NAICS) code is 611210 with a small business size standard of $22 million."

Services: Environment, Abatement, Remediation, Hazardous Bids,CA,F--Groundwater Monitoring,Federal,,Department of the Interior,"Jun 16, 2022",Department of the Interior,https://sam.gov/opp/2f8a08ee6ec54819bc6131e0b2a4c929/view,"140R2022Q0091
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,202-208-3100,ctikotsky@usbr.gov,,"This is not a solicitation announcement. This is a sources sought synopsis only pursuant to FAR Part 10, Market Research. This is NOT a request for proposals and in no way obligates the Government to award any contract. The purpose of this sources sought synopsis is to gain knowledge of commercially available products/services that may be of interest to the Bureau of Reclamation. The Bureau of Reclamation, Interior Region 10 - California Great Basin, Service & Supply Team has a requirement for Groundwater and Surface Water Monitoring Services to be done at Sliger Mine, California and New Melones, California starting 1 September 2022 for a base year with four one-year options. The purpose of this requirement is to obtain efficient and effective ground water monitoring and reporting services at Sliger Mine, California and New Melones, California. The Contractor shall furnish all the contract management, planning, supervision, administration, personnel, materials, supplies, transportation, facilities, and anything else necessary to complete the work and deliverables as defined within the upcoming Performance Work Statement (PWS). The contractor will perform all surface water and groundwater monitoring, sampling, data collection and laboratory analysis, report preparation and submission associated with permit requirements. All surface water and groundwater monitoring reports shall be prepared under the direct supervision of a California Registered Engineer or Geologist and signed by a registered professional. Container materials, volumes, and preservation requirements are determined by the analytical methods. Contractor will only use analytical laboratories certified by state of California. Laboratories will follow the protocols for preparation, analysis, and corrective actions stated in the analytical methods and the laboratory quality documents. Contractor shall follow methods prescribed for equivalent standard method to meet permit compliance. This notice is to assist the Bureau of Reclamation in determining potential sources only. All firms responding to this sources sought notice are advised that their response to this notice is not a request to be considered for a contract award. Reimbursement will not be made for any costs associated with providing information to this sources sought. All interested parties must respond to any subsequent solicitation notice published on the Sam.gov formerly known as Federal Business Opportunities website, www.sam.gov. Competition and set-aside decisions may be based on the results of this market research. Companies wishing to be considered for this project should send a capability statement to ctikotsky@usbr.gov. Please provide the following information to support your company's ability to perform this work: 1. A capability statement that explains what type of work your company has experience performing. Please provide information on whether your company can fill all of the requirements described above or if only interested in a portion of it. If only interested in a portion, please be specific on what services identified above are applicable. Also, please be sure to list your business size status, for example whether your company is a small business, 8(a), HUBZONE, women owned, small disadvantaged business, veteran owned, large business, etc. 2. Past performance in this area including: ? Contract Number, type of contract ? Length of contract ? Customer: (Agency or business), Contact information including name, address, telephone no., email address. ? Description of work ? Contract Dollar Value ? Date of Award and Completion (including extensions) ? Type and Extent of Subcontracting ? Quality of Performance, Contract Schedule, and Customer Relations ? Problems encountered and corrective action taken Telephone responses will NOT be accepted. Responses are requested no later than 4:00pm Pacific Standard Time, Thursday, 16 June 2022. Thank you for your time and interest with this requirement."

column3: ",Purchasing,,209-525-7640,,,"Stanislaus County Public Works is now accepting bids for the North County Corridor Structure Security, Hazardous Material Assessment, Mitigation and Demolition. column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,Jennifer.Sarraga@va.gov,,"The VA Southern Nevada Health Care System s planning and development located in North Las Vegas, NV has issued Request for Quote (RFQ) 36C26122Q0369 to procure comprehensive Annual and Tri-Annual Inspection and Testing Services of nine Xerxes fiber glass tanks as well as all ancillary equipment associated with each fuel oil tanks. This firm-fixed price solicitation will be conducted in accordance with FAR Part 13.5 Simplified Acquisition Procedures and the corresponding NAICS Code is 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services. Please see RFQ document 36C26122Q0369 for requirements. Quoters are to follow the instructions in RFQ document 36C26122Q0369. An itemized quote as well as sufficient technical, past performance, and supporting documentation is mandatory. This supporting documentation will be used to determine whether or not the quoted items meet the requirements of the solicitation. Quotes are due no later than 11:00 AM Pacific Time, June 14, 2022. Telephone calls will not be accepted. All quotes are to be sent via email to Jennifer Sarraga at jennifer.sarraga@va.gov with Courtesy Copy (CC) to Jared Dawson at jared.dawson@va.gov."

column1: Services: Environment, Abatement, Remediation, Hazardous Bids,CA,B--Post-Processing/Annotating Images of Nesting Geese in Arctic Alaska,Federal,,Department of the Interior,"Jun 9, 2022",Department of the Interior,https://sam.gov/opp/67a4aa463c3349ff812e882f8f618d23/view,"140G0322Q0136
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,202-208-3100,nlushenko@usgs.gov,,"Notice of Intent This is a notice of intent to solicit from a single source. The U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), intends to negotiate a purchase order with ABR Inc., Fairbanks, Alaska for a contractor to process imagery from a photo survey of nesting geese in Arctic Alaska, counting geese, identifying to species, and identifying behaviors (flying versus sitting on nests) as described in the attached Statement of Work. Award will be made in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 13.106-1(b) and the procedures at FAR Part 12 entitled, Acquisition of Commercial Items and FAR Part 13 entitled, Simplified Acquisition Procedures. ABR is, to the USGS? knowledge, the only source who has the expertise and familiarity with the region, with the equipment and survey methods used, with identifying species and behaviors via post-processing/annotating images, and with the challenges of working in remote locations on the north slope. The purpose of this notice is to satisfy the requirements of FAR Subpart 5.2. This notice of intent is not a request for competitive quotes. However, all responsible parties may submit a quotation by the closing date of this announcement which shall be considered by the agency. No solicitation will be issued. A determination not to compete this action based upon responses received is in the sole discretion of the Government. The NAICS code for this action is 541620, Environmental Consulting Services, with an associated size standard $16.5 million annually apply to this announcement. Responses or inquiries shall only be accepted through electronic mail addressed to nlushenko@usgs.gov and must be uploaded and received in their entirety no later than 09 June, 2022 at 1700 Eastern Time. Statement of Work is Attached."

column1: Services: Environment, Abatement, Remediation, Hazardous Bids,CA,Bids for Source Testing for City Landfill Flares,State/Local,,"Sacramento, California","Jun 10, 2022","Sacramento, California",,"B22155771006
column3: ",Purchasing,,916-808-6240,,,"The City is seeking a contractor to provide all services required to perform a source test for each of the City’s flares currently in operation at the 28th Street Landfill, located at the intersection of 28th Street and McKinley Village Way:

column1: 1. East Flare, per Permit No. TV2016-08-01, issued by the Sacramento Metropolitan Air Quality Management District (Air Board). The testing requirements are described in Section V.B., paragraph 12, on page 37 of the permit. Testing must be complete by December 19 of each year.
2. West Flare, per Permit No. 25596, also issued by the Sacramento Air Board. The
testing requirements are described in Section 24 on page 7 of the permit. Testing must be
complete by November 6 of each year.

Services: Environment, Abatement, Remediation, Hazardous Bids,CA,RFP for Environmental and Hazardous Materials Support Services,State/Local,,"San Francisco County, California","Jun 10, 2022","San Francisco County, California",https://sfcitypartner.sfgov.org/pages/Events-BS3/event-search.aspx,"0000006982
column3: ",Purchasing,,415-554-6743,,,"This Request for Proposal (RFP) is issued for Environmental and Hazardous Materials support services by The Related Companies of California (“TRCC”) and Mercy Housing California (“Mercy”), the co-developers (“Developer”) of the 50-acre Sunnydale HOPE SF mixed income development (“Project”). The scope of work will cover Development Phase 3 of the overall project. Development Phase 3 includes the demolition of existing buildings owned and maintained by the San Francisco Housing Authority; the removal of adjacent publicly maintained infrastructure; the installation of new public infrastructure/open space, and the construction of new affordable and market rate buildings.

column1: The Developer requests consultant services from a firm with expertise in environmental monitoring and hazardous material testing and abatement strategies. The firm will be required to adhere to all Federal, State and local regulations related to project site testing and monitoring. The scope of services requested in this RFP include asbestos surveying and monitoring; air and dust monitoring; lead-containing paint surveying; PCB assessment and bulk sampling; as well as regulatory compliance reporting.
The SBE goal for the Phase 3 Infrastructure is 20%.  A 10% ratings bonus will be applied to SBEs that are proposed as prime consultant.

There is no pre-bid meeting but questions may be emailed by May 20 and a response will be provided by the Owner’s representatives by May 27.  Proposals should be emailed to Owner by June 10, 2022.  Interviews of short-listed firms will be planned for the week of June 20.  Please review RFP for details.
Services: Environment, Abatement, Remediation, Hazardous Bids,CA,RFQ for Biological Services,State/Local,,"San Diego, California","Jul 7, 2022","San Diego, California",,"D2205001
column3: ",Purchasing,,619-236-6000,,,"Consultants shall have experience, knowledge and familiarity with Federal, State and local codes and regulations to include, but not necessarily limited to: Clean Water Act, Fish and Game Code, Federal and State Endangered Species Acts, NEPA, CEQA, Multiple Species Conservation Program, SCP, NCCPs, etc. See the full description of the Scope of Services in the Request for Qualification - Appendix II.

Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction
Bid documents can be viewed at or obtained from:
Request for qualified bids from Subcontractors, Suppliers & Truckers for the following project:
Project: 2021 Greenback Lane Complete Streets Improvements Project ? City of Citrus Heights
Estimate: $2,400,000 Duration: 90 working days Agency Goals: 16.1% MBE and 6.9% WBE

Teichert Construction intends to work cooperatively with all qualified firms seeking work on this project, including but not limited to breaking out contract work items into economically feasible units to increase overall MBE/WBE participation. Plans and specifications are available from the municipality listed above and the Teichert?s Roseville Estimating office. For assistance obtaining or regarding the plans and specifications, please contact the listed Estimator.

100% Payment and Performance Bonds for subcontractors are required. Teichert will pay bond premium up to 2%. Insurance Waiver of subrogation also required. However, certified MBE/WBE's are encouraged to contact Teichert and request assistance if they are unable to meet Teichert's standard bonding or insurance requirements. MBE/WBE's also are encouraged to contact Teichert for assistance in obtaining lines of credit, equipment, supplies, materials or related assistance or services. Subcontractor, Supplier and Trucker quotes must be valid, at minimum, for the award period stated in the contract documents. Please note that this is a prevailing wage project and Teichert Construction is Union signatory. Subcontractors will be subject to the terms and conditions of Teichert's subcontract and safety documents available at www.teichert.com/for-subcontractors.cfm. Submission of a bid to Teichert will confirm that you have reviewed and accepted Teichert's subcontract form. Conditions or exceptions in Subcontractor?s quote are expressly rejected unless accepted in writing prior to bid. Subcontractor scopes and supplier quotes are required 24 hours prior to bid. Additional information and or assistance to MBE/WBE's available from: *** All Subcontractor Quotes must have the Department of Industrial Relations # to be ACCEPTED ***
A. Teichert & Son, Inc. dba Teichert Construc

column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,rebecca.l.schowalter@usda.gov,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.? This announcement constitutes the only solicitation:? offers are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. Services: Environment, Abatement, Remediation, Hazardous Bids,CO,Sources Sought: R--DOI/USDA Orphaned Well Support Services,Federal,,Department of the Interior,"Jun 20, 2022",Department of the Interior,https://sam.gov/opp/1921fd21de4743139471680a76a30e53/view,"140L0622R0035
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,202-208-3100,pjohnson@blm.gov,,"Purpose: The Bureau of Land Management (BLM) is issuing a Request for Information pursuant to FAR Part 10 Market Research for a contemplated multiple award contract vehicle for the Federal Orphaned Well Program on behalf of the Department of the Interior and Department of Agriculture. This specific posting is for support services required for the Federal Orphaned Well Program. The applicable North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code anticipated to be assigned to this requirement is 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services with a size standard of $16.5M. The estimated total value may be up to $50M per contract. The government anticipates conducting a competitive acquisition for this requirement. The amount of interest or lack thereof will determine the possibility of a small business or other socio-economic small business set-aside for the solicitation. Additional Information: Various attachments, including a Statement of Objectives, are included with this posting with additional information about this requirement. All documentation is considered to be in a DRAFT format and has been provided for comment. Comments received may be used to make corrections, revisions, and/or other requirement changes depending on the nature and type of information received. Cost Reimbursement: Response to this announcement is strictly voluntary; no reimbursement will be made for any costs associated with providing information in response to this announcement or any follow-up information requests. Industry Day/Information Exchange: The BLM intends to hold an Industry Day for the purpose of interactively exploring capabilities available within the industry for a full range of environmental services relating to the plugging and abandonment of orphaned oil and gas wells on Federal lands. BLM is looking to gain information that will facilitate an effective and efficient acquisition process for the required services, create business partnerships, and incorporate best practices of the industry community beneficial to meeting the goals of this project. The virtual Industry Day for this requirement will be held on June 15, 2022 from 9 AM MT through 10:30 AM MT. Following the Industry Day event, a listing of participants and presentation materials will be made publicly available. Registration/Submission Instructions: The Government will not review general capability statements. Registration is required for Industry Day attendance, and the event link will be provided upon completion. Interested respondents will also be asked to provide the following information and responses to capability questions. Vendor Name: Vendor Mailing Address: Vendor Point of Contact (POC): Vendor POC Title: Vendor POC Phone: Vendor POC E-Mail: DUNS: Unique Entity Identifier (UEI): Size status of Business (i.e., large business, small business, small disadvantage business, 8(a) firm, etc.): GSA Schedule Number (if applicable): Registration Link: https://forms.office.com/g/aZumSmfLPb Responses to capability questions will not be publicly posted."

column1: Services: Environment, Abatement, Remediation, Hazardous Bids,CT,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) MOLD REMEDIATION PROJECT IN DIMICK HALL,Federal,,Department of Homeland Security,"Jun 10, 2022",Department of Homeland Security,https://sam.gov/opp/71da9df519b04bc8999820743e7fa87d/view,"70Z039-22QCGA0001414
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-447-5478,noel.m.filipinas@uscg.mil,,"Dimick Hall Auditorium Located at US Coas Guard Academy New Londo, CT 06320 -Dimick Hall cleaning of HVAC vents with HEPA vacuum then wiping down with Fiberlock Shockwave or industry equivalent. Only the vents around the outside of the auditorium are required to be wiped down. The vents over 12 feet require the mold to be effectively removed. - Air scrubbers will be used for the duration of this project and must be able to move at least 12,000 cfm of air. The air scrubbers must have a HEPA filter and at least one pre filter on them. REQUIREMENTS The company conducting the requested services shall have experience in mold remediation and be mold remediation certified. SUBMITTALS The following shall be submitted to CGA prior to the start of work: Mold remediation certification. Site visit is highly recommended: Any bidder interested in completing the project shall perform a site visit to the locations of the project to become familiar with all the existing conditions under which the project will be performed prior to submitting their bid. Everyone will meet at 0900 on 6 June 2022 in the Sail Loft, USCG Academy. The POC for site visit  direction to the place is Jason Henry, tel no. (860) 444-8233 or email him at Jason.M.Henry@uscg.mil. ?He is also the POC if you have any questions on SOW."

column1: Services: Transportation, Charter, Taxi, Emergency Bids,AK,Rural Air Carriers-Medicaid Travel,State/Local,,State of Alaska,"Jun 16, 2022",State of Alaska,https://aws.state.ak.us/OnlinePublicNotices/Notices/View.aspx?id=206890,"2023-0200-5139
Project Name:  Rural Air Carriers –Medicaid Travel
Deadline Date:  Thursday,   June 16, 2022 @ 4:00 P.M. Alaska Time

Description:  This solicitation is intended to result in mandatory, multiple award term contracts to provide non-emergency rural air carrier services for Medicaid recipients and establish compensatory rates for such services. State of Alaska executive, legislative, and judicial branch employees, as well as employees of the University of Alaska, may purchase travel under the terms, conditions, and pricing of this contract on a non-mandatory basis. Rates established as a result of this solicitation are not intended for non-scheduled charter services.

For the purposes of this contract, “rural” refers to travel between city pairs within Alaska, except between 1) Anchorage and Juneau and 2) Anchorage and Fairbanks.  Reservations will be booked by the State of Alaska in accordance with prevailing state travel policies.
Office of Procurement and Property Management (OPPM)

Services: Transportation, Charter, Taxi, Emergency Bids,AR,Static Display Aircraft Maintenance,Federal,,Department of Defense,Today ,Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/048c7412cebf49a08841bcd2a1c3a864/view,"FA446022Q0207
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,camille.drackette@us.af.mil,,"THIS IS A SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE.??NO SOLICITATION IS AVAILABLE AT THIS TIME. The purpose of this Sources Sought Notice is to identify potential sources capable of performing the effort described herein pursuant to FAR part 10, Market Research and FAR part 19, Small Business Programs. This is for planning purposes only. Any information submitted by respondents to this Source Sought Notice is voluntary. The Air Force does not intend to award a contract on the basis of this notice or to otherwise pay for the information solicited. Respondents should not construe this notice as a commitment by the Air Force for any purpose, and should refrain from providing proprietary information in the response. 1. INTRODUCTION: This is the initial step in the planning process for Static Display Aircraft Maintenance. The 19 CONS/PKA at Little Rock Air Force Base seeks sources to provide maintenance (including washing and painting) of static displays. Draft Performance Work Statement (PWS) is attached. 19 CONS/PKA anticipates conducting a competitive acquisition for this effort. The effort is expected to result in a Firm-Fixed-Price contract. NAICS code is anticipated to be 488190, size standard $35 million.? 2. INSTRUCTIONS: All businesses capable of providing Static Display Aircraft Maintenance are invited to respond electronically. Responses shall include company name, address, DUNS number, CAGE code, point of contact with email address and telephone number, indicate business size (small business, small disadvantaged business, service-disabled veteran-owned small business, economically disadvantaged woman-owned small business, woman-owned small business, or HUBZone) using NAICS 488190, size standard $35 million, and indicate any current government contract vehicles you are currently apart of. The Air Force reserves the right to consider a small business set-aside for any subsequent acquisition based upon responses to this notice. In the event Small Business contractors are not available for adequate competition for this project, it will be advertised as unrestricted. Additionally, responses shall include the following: A completed and signed Sources Sought Information Request, posted with this announcement. A positive statement of intent to bid as a prime contractor. A listing of projects completed during the past three years, both for government and private industry. The type of project, dollar value, Contract number, location, and Point of Contact are to be included. Indicate if you were prime or subcontractor. A brief outline of resources, subcontractors, and key personnel that would be used to accomplish the contract. Small business respondents should provide a statement of capabilities to assist the Air Force in making a set-aside decision. Statement of Capabilities are limited to 5 pages, and should demonstrate capability to provide service. Responses must be received no later than Friday, 03 June 2022, and addressed to Camille Drackette at camille.drackette@us.af.mil or SSgt Trenton Sikute at trenton.sikute@us.af.mil. Performance Work Statement (PWS) attached.?"

column1: Services: Transportation, Charter, Taxi, Emergency Bids,CA,RFP for Management and Operation Of Specialized Paratransit Services,State/Local,,"Nevada County, California","Jun 17, 2022","Nevada County, California",https://www.nevadacountyca.gov/734/Purchasing,"RFP
column3: ",Purchasing,,(530) 265-1747,,,"RFP - Management and Operation Of Specialized Paratransit Services

column1: Nevada County is inviting proposals from qualified firms to provide for the operation of Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and on-demand paratransit public transit services, Nevada County Now, in the Western Nevada County region. The Western Nevada County region spans the cities of Grass Valley and Nevada City, Alta Sierra, Penn Valley, Lake Wildwood and Lake of the Pines as well as the unincorporated areas of western Nevada County. The service area is traversed by three main highways: State Route (SR) 49 running north-south, SR 20 running east-west, and SR 174 running between Grass Valley and Colfax in Placer County. Western Nevada County is a rural area situated in the foothills of the Sierra Nevada mountains, covering approximately 618 square miles, ranging in elevation from approximately 700 ft above sea level on the western edge to roughly 5,500 ft at Bowman Lake in the north east. The County of Nevada’s ADA and On-demand paratransit service is known as Nevada County Now ( www.nevadacountynow.us ). Nevada County Now provides ADA paratransit service within ¾ mile of the local Nevada County Connects fixed route bus services (see map of service area), as well as serving the Penn Valley and Lake Wildwood areas. Additional services provided include: 65+ Senior On-demand dial-a-ride within the ¾ mile ADA zone, and ADA supplemental service which extends up to ¾ mile beyond normal ADA service area boundaries. Responders to this RFP should be aware that staffing transit in the Western Nevada County region can be challenging. There are two other major organizations in the region that provide transportation services, Durham school services and Placer County. Proposers are expected to apply due diligence and research the region’s cost of living, workforce, wages, housing, weather conditions, etc. Do not request this information from the County, Proposer is required to conduct its own research. For purposes of this Request for Proposals (RFP), the County is soliciting proposals for the operation of two different types of paratransit services in the region: *Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) mandated paratransit services *Non-ADA mandated paratransit *Advance reservation supplemental zone ADA service (based on resource capacity restraints) *65+ Senior On-demand same day dial-a-ride service (based on resource capacity constraints) Optional value add: same day on-demand Optional value add: zone based on-demand *denotes required components of operations and cost proposals. Proposals must include items 1, 2, 2a and 2b, with separate lines for items 2c and 2d using the Cost Proposal Form. The selected Contractor will be required to execute a Professional Services Contract and a Lease Agreement for use of County Transit Fleet (draft Contracts are included in Attachment C of this RFP). The term of this contract is at the sole discretion of the COUNTY and will commence on October 1, 2022 and end on June 30, 2027, for a total of five (5) years, with an additional two (2) one-year contract extension options beyond the five-year term that may be exercised by THE COUNTY at the sole discretion of THE COUNTY. A copy of the full RFP is available below and includes a description of the scope of work, proposal requirements, and instructions for submitting your proposal."

Services: Transportation, Charter, Taxi, Emergency Bids,FL,Naval Air Warfare Center Training Systems Division (NAWCTSD) **HYBRID** Procurement Administrative Lead Time (PALT) Meeting,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jul 13, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/ec80f8ce5a0049f8961ae22bb876142d/view,"NAWCTSDJuly2022PALT
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,,,"** Updated 06/01 to include Orange County COVID-19 information and impacts to PALT** Date & Time: ???????? 12 July 2022 1330 - 1530?? Agenda:? ??? ????????? Opening Remarks Procurement Overview Questions and Answers Closing Remarks Location: In-Person Tech Grove Building 4 (PIV) 12809 Science Drive Orlando, FL. 32826 ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?? Purpose:? Provide updated information and answer questions about ongoing acquisitions, formally announced Registration:?????? VIRTUAL: Attendees can register via Zoom link. ???? ?????????? https://www.zoomgov.com/webinar/register/WN_LLQSu8BlSWalMFTGMLHNpw ???????????????????????????? IN-PERSON: RSVP is required. Attendees can respond by emailing Orlo_BusinessSupportTeam@navy.mil?????? The following information is required for registration: Name Company Business Email address, **NOTE**??The CDC has raised the Orange County COVID-19 Community Level to Medium which required NSA Orlando to switch to HPCON B.? The implication to PALT is that all physical attendees will be required to be fully vaccinated.? Please be prepared to present a valid vaccination card (or photo of it) for verification of your fully vaccinated status, or complete and present a signed DD3150 form (located here:?https://www.esd.whs.mil/Portals/54/Documents/DD/forms/dd/dd3150.pdf) ? neither card nor form will be retained by PALT staff. Confirmation: An automated PALT confirmation email will be sent to registrants with instructions for attendance. Rules of Engagement: Request that in-person attendance RSVP Procurements discussed will be limited to what has been formally announced via SAM.Gov, TSIS or the NAWCTSD Business Opportunities webpage Source selection sensitive or contractor proprietary information will not be discussed No classified information, including Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI), will be discussed NAWCTSD Program Directors, or their deputies, will attend to provide the status ?updates Additional Info: Please join NAWCTSD Leadership and Program Directors for ?Quick Chats? immediately following the 12 July PALT session. Quick Chats will be held in-person at the Tech Grove to provide an opportunity for Industry to interact on a one-on-one basis with NAWCTSD personnel. Carving out time on our calendars for office calls and meetings between Industry & NAWCTSD can be frustrating and fraught with schedule changes, often taking months to align.? Quick Chats is designed to alleviate this frustration and aims to get us connected to quickly assess if there is a potential match in terms of Industry offerings and Government needs. As the name implies, Quick Chats is designed with speed in mind, so please be mindful of the time so that others have the opportunity to make connections. Leticia Lapp, NAWCTSD, Industry Outreach, Orlo_BusinessSupportTeam@navy.mil, 407-380-4411"

column1: Services: Transportation, Charter, Taxi, Emergency Bids,ID,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Airtanker Industry Day 2022,Federal,,Department of Agriculture,"Jun 7, 2022",Department of Agriculture,https://sam.gov/opp/edfae31dc6a144da8ad31b79b34fa8b8/view,"SN-2022-05-01
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,matthew.olson@usda.gov,,"The USFS intends to host an Airtanker Industry Day in Boise, ID on June 7, 2022 at 10AM. We anticipate that the meeting will ne nore more than 3 hours long. The primary focus of this meeting will be to discuss the Draft Airtanker MATOC RFP and the written responses we've received. The final location is TDB but will be posted shortly. We are limiting the number of in-person participants from each vendor to 3. There will be a virtual option for those that can't attend in person. An Agenda for the meeting will posting before the June 7 meeting. The event will be held at the following location: Best Western Vista Inn 2645 W Airport Way Boise, ID 83705 Bitterroot Room 1000-1200 Registration/Sign-In from 9AM-10AM Event runs 10AM-12PM (can potential go longer if necessary) Please e-mail Matthew.Olson@usda.gov and Leslie.Casavan@usda.gov a list on your in-person attendees by June 3. Finalized Agenda to be posted next week."

column1: Services: Transportation, Charter, Taxi, Emergency Bids,ID,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Aviation Maintenance Services,Federal,,Department of Agriculture,Today ,Department of Agriculture,https://sam.gov/opp/0d6fd71b790348cfab7897a7e0b568e7/view,"1202SA22R9503
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,vicki.keen@usda.gov,,"Aviation Maintenance Services The objective of this solicitation and any resulting contract(s) is to obtain Aviation Maintenance Services for US Forest Service fleet aircraft. The Contractor will provide for shop maintenance meeting the minimum requirements of the solicitation on an on-demand basis.? The US Forest Service has a requirement to maintain US Forest Service fleet aircraft in Redmond, OR, and Boise, ID. The resulting contract(s) will be Base + 4 Option year Indefinite Delivery, Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) Contract(s) with a guarantee $2,500 over the course of the contract. ? The solicitation and resulting contract will include Alternate 1 of the Government Property Clause. Please note that FAR 52.245-1 Alternate 1, shifts the risk of any loss of Government Property to the Contractor as follows.? 52.245-1, Alternate I (Apr 2012). As prescribed in 45.107(a)(2), substitute the following for paragraph (h)(1) of the basic clause:? (h)(1) The Contractor assumes the risk of, and shall be responsible for, any loss of Government property upon its delivery to the Contractor as Government-furnished property. However, the Contractor is not responsible for reasonable wear and tear to Government property or for Government property properly consumed in performing this contract. The resulting contract(s) will be firm fixed rate IDIQ Contract for maintenance crew services.? This requirement is set aside for small business. ?"

column1: Services: Transportation, Charter, Taxi, Emergency Bids,IL,Global Privately-Owned Vehicle-V (GPC-V) RFI,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 22, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/1f83917a9ee5481aaba2721fb5f94b19/view,"TRANSCOM22R018
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,nicole.a.radake.civ@mail.mil,,"USTRANSCOM is seeking sources that possess the capacity and?capability to provide end-to-end logistics for global privately owned vehicle (POV) transportation and storage services for U.S. military Service members, civilians employees, and authorized family members. Services include operating multiple vehicle processing centers (VPCs) to receive, inspect, and deliver customers? POVs; performing POV entitlement counseling; preparing POVs for transport/storage; ensuring all necessary agriculture and customs clearances are accomplished; handling customs for import and export vehicles; arranging for and/or providing ocean and inland transportation of the POVs between VPCs and other worldwide designated or directed locations; maintaining and servicing POVs that are in storage; providing information on the status and location of POV shipments (i.e., intransit visibility); resolving POV loss, damage, and/or inconvenience claims and settlements with customers/USG; reporting performance, program information, and metrics; and communicating customer responsibilities for preparing POVs for transportation and/or storage, primarily Department of Defense (DoD) and Department of State personnel."

column1: Sourcewell, a State of Minnesota local government unit and service cooperative, is requesting proposals for Snow and Ice Handling Equipment, Supplies, and Accessories to result in a contracting solution for use by its Participating Entities.
Sourcewell Participating Entities include thousands of governmental, higher education, K-12 education, nonprofit, tribal government, and other public agencies located in the United States and Canada.

A full copy of the Request for Proposals can be found on the Sourcewell Procurement Portal https://proportal.sourcewell-mn.gov. Only proposals submitted through the Sourcewell Procurement Portal will be considered.
Proposals are due no later than June 22, 2022, at 4:30 p.m. Central Time, and late proposals will not be considered."

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,julian.p.garibay.civ@us.navy.mil,,"This is a Request for Quote (RFQ) solicitation for non-commercial items. This is an all-or-none requirement and partial quotes will be deemed unresponsive and will not be evaluated. The Government will award on a single purchase order to the responsible Offeror whose offer conforms to the requirements as stated in the Solicitation and is most advantageous to the Government based on the criteria listed in section L and section M of the solicitation. Offerors must be registered in SAM and all responsible sources may submit a quotation which, if timely received, will be considered by the Agency. Quotes are due no later than the response date in the posting. Responses/offers shall be submitted electronically via email to Julian Garibay at email julian.p.garibay.civ@us.navy.mil. Any amendment(s) issued to this RFQ will be published on this website. Therefore, it is the Offerors responsibility to visit this website frequently for updates on this procurement."

column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,norbert.reed@va.gov,,"Network Contracting Office 8 (NCO 8) intends to negotiate a sole source contract with Shield Security System, LLC DBA: Instakey Security System of Lakewood, CO to provide perimeter door hardware for the San Juan VAMC in San Juan, PR. This is a purchase for a single purchase. This procurement is being conducted in accordance FAR 6.302-1, only one responsible source and no other supplies or services will satisfy the agency requirements. Contract is firm fixed price and the NAICS Code is 332510. This Notice of Intent is not a request for competitive proposals. No solicitation documents are available and telephone requests will not be honored. However, if a firm believes it can meet the requirements it must furnish information about its products and services, as well as references from other customers who are using these products and services to provide perimeter door hardware, to the Contracting Officer within two (2) calendar days from the date of publication of this synopsis. Supporting evidence must be furnished in sufficient detail to demonstrate the ability to comply with the above requirements, specifically demonstrating access to Original Manufacturer Equipment (OEM) parts. Information must be sent to norbert.reed@va.gov via email. Responses received will be evaluated; however, a determination by the Government not to compete the proposed procurement based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. If no responses are received, NCO 8 will proceed with the sole source negotiation with Shield Security System, LLC DBA: Instakey Security System."

column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,Joshua.Gallien@va.gov,,"** AMENDMENT A00001 Best Lock Acquisition with Installation Leeds MA Solicitation Amendment ** The purpose of this solicitation amendment is to establish a site visit and alter the solicitation question and due date time frame. Solicitation Changes: Original: Submission of Quotes: (3) Questions: Questions shall be submitted to the Contracting Officer / Contracting Specialist in writing via e-mail. Oral questions are not acceptable due to the possibility of misunderstanding or misinterpretation. A site visit is not scheduled at this time. Questions received after this date and time may not be answered. Questions will be answered in a formal amendment to the solicitation so all interested parties can see the answers. Has changed to: (3) Questions: Questions shall be submitted to the Contracting Officer / Contracting Specialist in writing via e-mail. Oral questions are not acceptable due to the possibility of misunderstanding or misinterpretation. A site visit is scheduled for 25-May-2022 at 1:00PM EST., location Building 7 (lake Building) cell phone number for the site visit POC is 413-685-5092. Questions are due no later than 31-May-2022 by 9:00 AM EST, questions received after this date and time may not be answered. Questions will be answered in a formal amendment to the solicitation so all interested parties can see the answers. (see attached site plan for map of the campus) Price schedule: POP dates have been updated. (Please note that dates are tentative and are subject to change) ITEM NUMBER DESCRIPTION OF SUPPLIES/SERVICES QUANTITY UNIT UNIT PRICE AMOUNT 0001 Provide Best Lock Cylinders. As outlined in the PWS. POP Begin: 20-June-22 POP End: 31-Oct-22 1 JB __________________ 0002 Installation of Best Lock Cylinders as outlined in the PWS. POP Begin: 20-June-22 POP End: 31-Oct-22 1 JB __________________ 0003 Keying system deliverable as outlined in the PWS. POP Begin: 20-June-22 POP End: 31-Oct-22 1 JB __________________ Total Cost: Section xv Original: (xv) RFQ responses are due 19-May-2022 at 10:00 AM EST. RFQ responses must be submitted via email to: Joshua.Gallien@va.gov. Hand deliveries will not be accepted. Has Changed to: (xv) RFQ responses are due 03-June-2022 at 1:00 PM EST. RFQ responses must be submitted via email to: Joshua.Gallien@va.gov. Hand deliveries will not be accepted."

column1: Equipment: Tools, Hand, Power Bids,MD,"CCU -22 W0 1146 Seals, Sleeves, and Firing Pin",Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 8, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/ad0eecd6e4a94563a01601336d742cd9/view,"N0017422Q0062
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,sarah.n.hayden@navy.mil,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for non-commercial items prepared in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. Naval Surface Warfare Center Indian Head Division (NSWC IHD), located in Indian Head, Maryland intends to award a firm fixed price (FFP) purchase order using Simplified Acquisition Procedures for: CCU -22 W0 1146 Seals, Sleeves, and Firing Pin. This solicitation will be competed as Full and Open. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation. Quotes are being requested under Request for Quotation (RFQ) no. N0017422Q0062. The NAICS code is 332510 and the business size standard is 750. The provisions and clauses included and/or incorporated in this solicitation document are those in effect through the Federal Acquisition Circular. This RFQ incorporates all provisions and clauses in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular FAC 2020-01 and the Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS) DPN 20190531. The Government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible vendor whose quote, conforming to the solicitation that will be most advantageous to the Government, price and other factors considered. The Government intends to evaluate all timely quotes received from eligible vendors on a lowest price technically acceptable (LPTA) basis. The Government intends to evaluate quotations and award a contract without discussions with quoters. The Government reserves the right to conduct discussions if the Contracting Officer later determines them to be necessary. Evaluation Factors (in order of importance) Technical ? Quotes submitted shall address all requirements included in the RFQ and SOW. Price ? Quotes must include all applicable costs. Submitted quotes are NOT TO EXCEED 250,000.00 (Simplified Acquisition Threshold). In order to submit a proposal, technical drawings must be requested. Technical Drawings: This procurement includes unclassified controlled technical information assigned a restricted distribution statement which is export controlled. To receive this unclassified controlled technical information, an Offeror must be currently certified through the United States/Canada Joint Certification Program. To become certified for receipt of the technical documents, a U.S. Offeror must submit a completed DD Form 2345 to the U.S./Canada Joint? Certification Office. Canadian Offerors may submit either a completed DD Form 2345 or DSS-MAS 9379 for certification. In addition, a copy of the company's State/Provincial Business License, Incorporation Certificate, sales Tax Identification Form or other documentation which verifies the legitimacy of the company must accompany all DD Form 2345s. Additional information on the Joint Certification Program and a checklist for completion of the DD Form 2345 is available at the following website: http://www.dla.mil/HQ/InformationOperations/Offers/Products/LogisticsApplications/JCP/. Offerors are encouraged to apply for certification as early as possible in order for processing and receipt of information to be completed in sufficient time to prepare a proposal before solicitation closing. If interested, technical drawings need to be requested by contractor prior to submission date. ITAR certification is required to be provided prior to technical drawing release. Drawing requests must be made via email to sarah.n.hayden@navy.mil, james.a.wright308.civ@us.navy.mil, and david.greaves@navy.mil by Tuesday 31 May 2022 1:00 PM EST. Questions/clarification regarding this solicitation must be submitted via email to sarah.n.hayden@navy.mil, james.a.wright308.civ@us.navy.mil, and david.greaves@navy.mil by Thursday 2 June 2022 12:00 PM EST. All responses will be provide COB Monday 6 June 2022. Teaming arrangements is an acceptable practice and should be considered when proposing to the Government requirements. Quote packages are due by 8?June 2022 4:00 PM EST (COB). Late quotes will not be considered. Please fill in clauses in RFQ as they apply to your business. Quote packages shall be sent to sarah.n.hayden@navy.mil, james.a.wright308.civ@us.navy.mil, and david.greaves@navy.mil and contain a cover sheet that provides the following information: 1. Official Company Name; 2. Point of contact including name and phone number; and 3. DUNS number and Cage Code. The Points of Contact for this acquisition is Sarah Hayden, at sarah.n.hayden@navy.mil Dr. David Greaves, at david.greaves@navy.mil James Wright, at james.a.wright308.civ@us.navy.mil"

column1: Equipment: Tools, Hand, Power Bids,MS,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): 51--Fluid Boss Adapter Tools Kits,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 14, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/62d2e8f02671412da1d02f940117c010/view,"N68335-22-Q-0162
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is N68335-22-Q-0162 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 332216 with a small business size standard of 750.00 employees. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified sellers may submit quotes. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-06-14 14:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be Gulfport , MS 39501 The NAWC-AD Lakehurst requires the following items, Purchase Description Determined by Line Item, to the following: LI 001: Fluid Boss Adapter Tools Kits (Size 08)(PN: KM13, NSN: 5180-00-283-6993). Only the Government part number (exact match) will suffice. Units will support Kuwait F/A-18 E-F Super Hornet Program, via Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Case KU-P-SBG. FOB Origin - Proposed unit pricing for this CLIN should NOT include shipping costs, as they will be paid by a freight forwarder. EXACT P/N REQUIRED; NO SIMILAR ITEMS WILL SATISFY THE REQUIREMENT., 4, EA; LI 002: Fluid Boss Adapter Tools Kits (Size 04)(PN: KM18, NSN: 5180-00-283-6999). Only the Government part number (exact match) will suffice. Units will support Kuwait F/A-18 E-F Super Hornet Program, via Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Case KU-P-SBG. FOB Origin - Proposed unit pricing for his CLIN should NOT include shipping costs, as they will be paid by a freight forwarder. EXACT P/N REQUIRED; NO SIMILAR ITEMS WILL SATISFY THE REQUIREMENT., 3, EA; LI 003: Fluid Boss Adapter Tool Kits (Size 10) (PN: KM19, NSN: 5180-00-283-6989). Only the Government part number (exact match) will suffice. Units will support Kuwait F/A-18 E-F Super Hornet Program, via Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Case KU-P-SBG. FOB Origin - Proposed unit pricing for his CLIN should NOT include shipping costs, as they will be paid by a freight forwarder. EXACT P/N REQUIRED; NO SIMILAR ITEMS WILL SATISFY THE REQUIREMENT., 4, EA; LI 004: Fluid Boss Adapter Tool Kits (Size 06) (PN: KM30, NSN: 5180-01-075-0766). Only the Government part number (exact match) will suffice. Units will support Kuwait F/A-18 E-F Super Hornet Program, via Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Case KU-P-SBG. FOB Origin - Proposed unit pricing for his CLIN should NOT include shipping costs, as they will be paid by a freight forwarder. EXACT P/N REQUIRED; NO SIMILAR ITEMS WILL SATISFY THE REQUIREMENT., 3, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested Offerers must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, NAWC-AD Lakehurst intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing quotes, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. NAWC-AD Lakehurst is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time quotes. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their quote using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a quote on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerers that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith quotes, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should Offerers require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. Bid MUST be good for 120 calendar days after close of Buy. Delivery shall be Free On Board (FOB) Origin (FAR 52.247-29) for FMS quantities under all CLIN's. Inspection and Acceptance will occur at Origin by DCMA or authorized Government representative. The Delivery Term Code (DTC) for this contract is DTC-2. Movement from origin to destination within CONUS. New Equipment ONLY; NO remanufactured or ""gray market"" items. All items must be covered by the manufacturer's warranty. This solicitation requires registration with the System for Award Management (SAM) at the time an offer or quotation is submitted, excluding the exceptions outlined in FAR 4.1102(a) in order to be considered for award, pursuant to applicable regulations and guidelines. Registration information can be found at www.sam.gov. Registration must be ""ACTIVE"" at the time of award. Registration information can be found at www.sam.gov. **See Attachment Evaluation Plan** This resultant contract will utilize FAR part 13 procedures. Please visit https://www.acquisition.gov/content/part-13-simplified-acquisition-procedures to familiarize yourself with the terms and conditions for simplified acquisition procedures. Delivery date of 259 days after contract award required. Early delivery will be accepted at no additional cost to the Government. The selected Offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions, which are incorporated herein by reference: FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items; FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders- Commercial Items, paragraph (a) and the following clauses in paragraph (b): 52.219-6, 52.219-28, 52.222-19, 52.222-21, 52.222-26, 52.222-50, 52.223-18, 52.225-13, 52.232-33. The full text of the referenced FAR clauses may be accessed electronically at https://www.acquisition.gov/far/. This procurement will be issued as a Small Business Set Aside under NAICS Code 332216 - Saw Blade and Handtool Manufacturing with a size standard of 750 employees. FAR 52.204-24 Representation Regarding Certain Telecommunications and Video Surveillance Services or Equipment (Oct 2020) applies to this solicitation and prior to award of the resulting contract action. 52.204-25 Prohibition on Contracting for Certain Telecommunications and Video Surveillance Services or Equipment (AUG 2020) applies to this procurement. By submitting a bid under this solicitation, the offeror understands the terms of this clause. FAR Provision 52.204-26 Covered Telecommunications Equipment or Services - Representation (Oct 2020) applies to this solicitation. Please update your SAM account to reflect the most recent FAR 52.204-26 Covered Telecommunications Equipment or Services - Representation (Oct 2020) provision. If your SAM account is updated to reflect the most recent FAR 52.204-26 Covered Telecommunications Equipment or Services - Representation (Oct 2020) provision and sections (d)(1) and (d)(2) are both checked ?does not? under representations, no further action is required. If your SAM account is not updated to reflect the most recent FAR 52.204-26 Covered Telecommunications Equipment or Services - Representation (Oct 2020) provision or sections (d)(1) and (d)(2) are not both checked ?does not? under representations in the updated provision, the Government will need a completed signed and dated copy of FAR 52.204-24 Fill-In sheet (Attachment 001 - FAR 52.204-24) prior to award. Sections (d)(1) and (d)(2) must be checked appropriately under representations. DFARS Provision 252.204-7008 Compliance with Safeguarding Covered Defense Information Controls (OCT 2016) applies to this solicitation. DFARS Clause 252.204-7012, ?Safeguarding Covered Defense Information and Cyber Incident Reporting? (December 2015), applies to this solicitation and resultant contract. By submitting a bid under this solicitation, the offeror understands the terms of this clause. 252.204-7018 Prohibition on the Acquisition of Covered Defense Telecommunications Equipment or Services DEC 2019 By submitting a bid under this solicitation, the offeror understands the terms of this clause. DFARS Provision 252.204-7019 Notice of NIST SP 800-171 DoD Assessment Requirements (NOV 2020) applies to this solicitation. In accordance with the requirement identified in DFARS 252.204-7019 paragraph (b), all interested vendors shall have a current assessment for each covered contractor information system that is relevant to the contract, task order or delivery order. DFARS 252.204-2019 paragraph (c) identifies the procedure by which interested vendors shall make the assessment score available to the Government (i.e., posting in the Supplier Performance Risk System (SPRS)). DFARS 252.204-7020 NIST SP 800-171 DoD Assessment Requirements (NOV 2020) applies to this procurement. By submitting a bid under this solicitation, the offeror understands the terms of this clause. DFARS Clause 252.211-7003, Item Identification and Valuation applies to end items that have a unit acquisition cost of $5,000 or more. All applicable FMS clauses shall apply to the resultant contract, including but not limited to: 52.247-29 F.O.B. Origin; 52.225-13 Restrictions on Certain Foreign Purchases; 252.225-7027 RESTRICTION ON CONTINGENT FEES FOR FOREIGN MILITARY SALES (APR 2003); 5252.247-9510 PRESERVATION, PACKAGING, PACKING AND MARKING FOR FOREIGN MILITARY SALES (FMS) REQUIREMENTS (NAVAIR)(OCT 2005); 5252.232-9522 TRANSPORTATION ACCOUNT CODES (NAVAIR) (OCT 2005); and G-TXT-07 ADDITIONAL FUNDING INFORMATION. The Government will only accept the Government's part name and part number listed in each line item (exact match). If the offeror submits an alternate or different part name or part number from the line item description, the quote may be rejected without further evaluation, deliberation or discussion. EXACT P/N REQUIRED; NO SIMILAR ITEMS WILL SATISFY THE REQUIREMENT."

In accordance with the requirement identified in DFARS 252.204-7019 paragraph (b), all interested vendors shall have a current assessment for each covered contractor information system that is relevant to the contract, task order or delivery order. DFARS 252.204-2019 paragraph (c) identifies the procedure by which interested vendors shall make the assessment score available to the Government (i.e., posting in the Supplier Performance Risk System (SPRS)). DFARS 252.204-7020 NIST SP 800-171 DoD Assessment Requirements (NOV 2020) applies to this procurement. By submitting a bid under this solicitation, the offeror understands the terms of this clause. DFARS Clause 252.211-7003, Item Identification and Valuation applies to end items that have a unit acquisition cost of $5,000 or more. All applicable FMS clauses shall apply to the resultant contract, including but not limited to: 52.247-29 F.O.B. Origin; 52.225-13 Restrictions on Certain Foreign Purchases; 252.225-7027 RESTRICTION ON CONTINGENT FEES FOR FOREIGN MILITARY SALES (APR 2003); 5252.247-9510 PRESERVATION, PACKAGING, PACKING AND MARKING FOR FOREIGN MILITARY SALES (FMS) REQUIREMENTS (NAVAIR)(OCT 2005); 5252.232-9522 TRANSPORTATION ACCOUNT CODES (NAVAIR) (OCT 2005); and G-TXT-07 ADDITIONAL FUNDING INFORMATION. The Government will only accept the Government's part name and part number listed in each line item (exact match). If the offeror submits an alternate or different part name or part number from the line item description, the quote may be rejected without further evaluation, deliberation or discussion. EXACT P/N REQUIRED; NO SIMILAR ITEMS WILL SATISFY THE REQUIREMENT."

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com,,"AMENDMENT NOTICE: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is N6833522Q0108_001 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-05. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 332216 with a small business size standard of 750.00 employees. This requirement is unrestricted and only qualified offerors may submit quotes. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-06-16 15:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be GULFPORT, MS 39501 The NAWC-AD Lakehurst requires the following items, Brand Name Only (Exact Match), to the following: LI 001: Calibration Gun Check Fixture PN: 152D5256 NSN: 5220-01-289-6319, 1, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested offerors must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, NAWC-AD Lakehurst intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing quotes, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. NAWC-AD Lakehurst is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time quotes. All responsible Offerors that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their quote using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a quote on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerors that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerors that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerors may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith quotes, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should offerors require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. New Equipment ONLY; NO remanufactured or ""gray market"" items. All items must Shipping must be free on board (FOB) destination CONUS (Continental U.S.), which means that the seller must deliver the goods on its conveyance at the destination specified by the buyer, and the seller is responsible for the cost of shipping and risk of loss prior to actual delivery at the specified destination. This solicitation requires registration with the System for Award Management (SAM) at the time an offer or quotation is submitted, excluding the exceptions outlined in FAR 4.1102(a). Registration information can be found at www.sam.gov. This procurement effort is intended to be awarded based on limited competition between the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) of this equipment, General Dynamics-OTS, Inc. and the company?s AUTORIZED DISTRIBUTORS. The NAWC-AD Lakehurst requires the following items, Exact Match, to the following: Calibration Gun Check Fixture (PN: 152D5256, NSN: 5220-01-289-6319) Bid MUST be good for 90 calendar days after close of Buy. Due to international agreements governing FMS acquisitions, FMS inspection and acceptance of the supplies to be furnished hereunder shall be performed by the DCMA cognizant office. Inspection and acceptance of supplies shall take place at the Contractor?s facility (Inspection/Acceptance at Origin). Acceptance of all Contract Line Items/Sub Line Items (CLINs/SLINs) shall be made by signature of the accepting authority on a DD 250 submitted through the Wide Area Workflow (WAWF) system. Acceptance will only occur when the accepting authority is sure that inspections performed demonstrate compliance with contract requirements. Failure to have DCMA inspect prior to shipment may result in the Contractor not being able to invoice the item and receive payment. Delivery terms shall be FOB Origin in accordance with FAR 52.247-29- FOB ORIGIN and therefore shipping costs should not be included in your quote. FMS contracts contain detailed instructions that apply to that specific contract because FMS are governed by international agreements with procedures that must be followed to ensure payment for the Contractor. The US Navy will work to arrange for pickup and shipment at no cost to the Contractor or the Government, as shipping costs are covered by the FMS customer. **See Attachment 001-Evaluation Plan** This resultant contract will utilize FAR part 13 procedures. Please visit https://www.acquisition.gov/content/part-13-simplified-acquisition-procedures to familiarize yourself with the terms and conditions for simplified acquisition procedures. Deliveries shall be made within twelve (12) months after order receipt. Early delivery is acceptable and encouraged. DFARS Clause 252.211-7003, Item Identification and Valuation applies to end items that have a unit acquisition cost of $5,000 or more. FAR 52.204-24 Representation Regarding Certain Telecommunications and Video Surveillance Services or Equipment (Oct 2020) applies to this solicitation and prior to award of the resulting contract action. Please fill out Attachment 001- FAR 52.204-24 Fill-In sheet and submit as part of your response to this solicitation. 52.204-25 Prohibition on Contracting for Certain Telecommunications and Video Surveillance Services or Equipment (AUG 2020) applies to this procurement. By submitting a bid under this solicitation, the offeror understands the terms of this clause. 252.204-7018 Prohibition on the Acquisition of Covered Defense Telecommunications Equipment or Services DEC 2019 By submitting a bid under this solicitation, the offeror understands the terms of this clause. DFARS Provision 252.204-7019 Notice of NIST SP 800-171 DoD Assessment Requirements (NOV 2020) applies to this solicitation. DFARS 252.204-7020 NIST SP 800-171 DoD Assessment Requirements (NOV 2020) applies to this procurement. By submitting a bid under this solicitation, the offeror understands the terms of this clause. All applicable FMS clauses shall apply to the resultant contract, including but not limited to: 52.247-29 F.O.B. Origin; 52.225-13 Restrictions on Certain Foreign Purchases; 252.225-7027 RESTRICTION ON CONTINGENT FEES FOR FOREIGN MILITARY SALES (APR 2003); 5252.247-9510 PRESERVATION, PACKAGING, PACKING AND MARKING FOR FOREIGN MILITARY SALES (FMS) REQUIREMENTS (NAVAIR)(OCT 2005); 5252.232-9522 TRANSPORTATION ACCOUNT CODES (NAVAIR) (OCT 2005); and G-TXT-07 ADDITIONAL FUNDING INFORMATION"
