column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,steven.behrns@usda.gov,,"This is a new requirement.? The US Forest Service (Alaska Region) seeks to procure (1) brand name only Bobcat S740 T4 Skid-Steer, with delivery to Thorne Bay, AK.? The Government intends to award one firm fixed price contract resulting from this solicitation. See attachments for additional details. Quotes are due June 14th, 2022 @ 12:00PM (AKST) Alaska Time, via email. Brand name justification: This Skid-Steer will be used in Thorne Bay, AK by Forest Service employees.? Communities in SE Alaska are?not connected to a traditional road system, accessible only by marine ferry or by air.? Major repair and warranty work needs to be performed in a SE community as close to Thorne Bay as possible.?Currently, only Bobcat brand can be serviced in SE Alaska and has a model that meets all required specifications.? This brand name request (FAR 6.302-1) reduc??es the duplication of costs [FAR 6.303-2(b)(9)(ii)] associated with having repair work performed.? Any other brand would have to be shipped to Anchorage or Seattle for warranty or major repair work."

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,CA,Bellows/Flanges,Federal,,Department of Energy,"Jun 16, 2022",Department of Energy,https://sam.gov/opp/0071a765fa5a4568ab7f8fa8c1784330/view,"0000329891
column5: ",Contracting Officer,,202-586-4403,angelag@slac.stanford.edu,,"SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is operated by Stanford University for the Department of Energy. As a management and operating contractor, subcontracts awarded by the Laboratory are not Federal procurements, and are not directly subject to the Federal Acquisition Regulations in 48 CFR. Nonetheless, certain Federal laws, Executive Orders, and regulations may affect our DOE approved purchasing system, as required by statute, regulation, or contract terms and conditions. SLAC has a requirement for a U.S. domestic end item source of the following Kurt. J. Lesker products or equivalent: Quantity: 1, SKU0134158, MEW4974001C3, EUDF-SUPP BELLOWS,E-W,4.97""OD,4""ID,1SEG 6""UHVS,1-FXD,1-ROT Quantity: 1, SKU0134124, MEW3502501C3, EUDF-SUPP BELLOWS,E-W,3.50""OD,2.50""ID,1 SEG,4-1/2""UHVS Quantity: 2, SKU0130246, PA64-H, EUDF-SUPP PORT ALIGNER MOUNTED ON CFNW64 (4-1/2"" OD CF) FLANGES WITH THROUGH HOLES. PROVIDING +/-5MM AXIAL ADJUSTMENT ALONG WITH +/-2 DEGREES OF TILT. 65MM BELLOWS CLEAR BORE. BAKEABLE TO 250 DEGREES CELSIUS. Quantity: 2, SKU0140977, RF450X275, EUDF-SUPP REDUCING FLANGE, 4-1/2"" OD X 2-3/4"" FLANGE Quantity: 2, SKU0123558, F0800N000NLN, EUDF-SUPP FLANGE,UHV,316LN,ESR,BLANK,FXD, 8""OD Quantity: 2, SKU0242514, 54124-GE02, EUDF-SUPP ANGLE VALVE,ALL METAL XHV,SERIES 54 VAT,STAINLESS STEEL,DN16 CF FLANGED,ROTATABLE,MANUAL, ACTUATOR,HEXAGONAL HEAD Quantity: 2, SKU0242517, 54136-GE02, EUDF-SUPP ANGLE VALVE,ALL METAL XHV,SERIES 54 VAT,STAINLESS STEEL,DN63 CF FLANGED,ROTATABLE,MANUAL, ACTUATOR,HEXAGONAL HEAD Quantity: 1, SKU0151793, ?VPZL-800, EUDF-SUPP VIEWPORT,ZERO-LENGTH,8""UHV Quantity: 1, SKU0311062, ?PP40-457-H, EUDF-SUPP POWERPROBE MAGNETICALLY COUPLED TRANSFER ARM, LINEAR/ROTARY, 457MM STROKE, 2-3/4""OD CF (DN40CF), POSITION LOCK The award will be made based upon the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable method. Marking of Proprietary/Confidential Information. Offerors shall properly mark and identify with a restrictive legend or information markings on pages of the proposal that contain Proprietary/confidential information. For Offeror to be eligible for a subcontract award with the University and the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE), Offeror shall be registered with the System for Award Management (SAM). Entities may register at no cost directly at the SAM website: https://www.sam.gov. The resulting purchase order shall be performed in accordance with SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory's Terms and Conditions for Fixed Price Commercial Supplies and Services dated December 2016 NOTE: The following documents are attached in this solicitation. Buy American Act Certificate Terms & Conditions for Fixed Price Commercial Supplies and Services, December 2016 Please provide quoted price, delivery, technical compliance statement and certification to the attention of Angela Garcia. Payment Terms: Net 30 days Freight terms: FOB Destination Prepaid and Add"

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,CA,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): MOTCO Rail Spanners,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 15, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/98279515ad4b4364b9cc93a9bdaad8bd/view,"PANROC-22-P-004882
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,bobbi.l.shannon.civ@army.mil,,"Solicitation Number: W52P1J-22-R-0053 Closing Date and Time: 1000 Central Time, 15 June 2022 Purchasing Agency: Army Contracting Command - Rock Island (ACC-RI) 100% Small Business Set Aside under North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) 332312 - Fabricated Structural MetalManufacturing 1. This is a solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with (IAW) Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation to be issued. 2. This Request for Quotes is issued pursuant to FAR 13 which authorizes the use of simplified procedures for the subject acquisition. The Army Contracting Command - Rock Island (ACC-RI) hereby requests proposed pricing for Twenty (20) Aluminum Rail Spanners; the salient characteristics can be found at Attachment 001. This requirement supports the Surface Deployment and Distribution Command (SDDC), 834th Transportation Battalion, at the Military Ocean Terminal Concord, California (MOTCO). INSTRUCTIONS TO OFFERORS 3. It is the Governments intent to award one single Firm Fixed Price type contract. The Government reserves the right to award based on the quality of responses, prices submitted, and the availability of funds. 4. Offerors shall submit proposed prices per single unit, and a total evaluated price. Failure to provide pricing for all required items is unacceptable and may render the Offeror ineligible for award. Quotes must be valid for 30 days. COMPETITION & EVALUATION 5. Quotes received will be evaluated based on Lowest Price Technically Acceptable basis. 6. The Government intends to award without exchanges with Offerors. However, the Government reserves the right to conduct exchanges, if necessary. The Government anticipates receiving competitive proposals and using competition to determine price reasonableness. The Government reserves the right to request data other than certified cost or pricing data, after receipt of proposals, to determine price reasonableness if competition is not adequate. ADDITIONAL GUIDANCE 7. FOB is destination. Contractor is to ensure that the shipping method allows the ability for the Government to track items to the final destination. Delivery shall be made to the following address no later than 60 days after the date of the award. Earlier delivery is authorized at no additional cost to the Government: Military Ocean Terminal Concord 596th Transportation Brigade Building 543 WHARF 3 Port Hueneme, CA. 93041 Government Point of Contact: Mr. Steve Jones, SoCal Traffic Management Supervisor PH: (805) 718-2393, Email: steven.d.jones30.civ@army.mil 8. Invoicing instructions shall be provided at the time of award. 9. Please note the U.S. Government will answer questions from industry via Amendment(s) to this notice. All questions shall be submitted electronically to Ms. Bobbi Shannon at bobbi.l.shannon.civ@army.mil and Mr. Ryan Buhman at ryan.j.buhman.civ@army.mil. 10. The solicitation closing date and time is 15 June 2022 at 1000 Central Time. Responses to this solicitation shall be submitted electronically only to Ms. Bobbi Shannon at bobbi.l.shannon.civ@army.mil and Mr. Ryan Buhman at ryan.j.buhman.civ@army.mil. Late proposals may be rejected."

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,CA,MK25 AFT FRAME,Federal,,Department of Defense,Today ,Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/50882b576dab43e38a3153e61befa39a/view,"N6426722Q0180
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,christopher.mokbel@navy.mil,,"This is a solicitation for noncommercial items prepared in accordance with FAR part 13.? This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.? The Naval Surface Warfare Center (NSWC) Corona Division requires MK25 AFT Frame.? The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 332710.? The anticipated contract type is Firm-Fixed-Price.? Set-aside status: Small Business Set Aside. This is an all-or-none requirement and partial proposals will be deemed unresponsive and will not be evaluated.? The Government will award on a single purchase order to the responsible Offeror whose offer conforms to the requirements as stated in the Solicitation and is most advantageous to the Government based on the criteria listed in Section L and Section M of the Solicitation.? Offerors must be registered in SAM and all responsible sources may submit a proposal which, if timely received, will be considered by the Agency.? Proposals are due no later than the response date in the posting.? Proposals shall be submitted electronically, PDF or MS Word format to christopher.mokbel@navy.mil Any amendment(s) issued to this Request For Proposals (RFP) will be published on this website.? Therefore, it is the Offerors responsibility to visit this website frequently for updates on this procurement.? No telephone requests.? All requests must include company name, address, POC name, telephone number, fax number, CAGE Code, Tax ID number, Business size, county and DUNS number.?"

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,payton.r.sutton.civ@us.navy.mil,,"*DETAILED DESCRIPTION ?? This notice is the posting of the Request for Proposal for this requirement. All responsible sources must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) database at the following website: https://www.sam.gov/portal/public/SAM/. ?NEW - All proposals must be submitted in the PIEE System. Offers to the solicitation shall be submitted via PIEE Solicitation Module, a new secure portal, for proposal submissions per the instructions in Section L of the solicitation. Offerors are required to register in PIEE to obtain access to the solicitation module (step-by-step directions for registering and posting proposals in PIEE are included in the attachments to this solicitation) and can register in PIEE, go to https://piee.eb.mil/, and click Register.? Written responses shall be submitted by e-mail to the point(s) of contact listed below no later than 5 days from this notice date.? Payton Sutton? Email: payton.r.sutton.civ@us.navy.mil? Brad Watson? Email: john.b.watson1.civ@us.navy.mil? CONTROLLED UNCLASSIFIED INFORMATION (CUI) Contractors must be certified through Defense Logistics Information Services (DLIS) in order to access Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) or Export Controlled Information. Access to CUI is limited, to a single point of contact (POC) per CAGE code, who is listed as the Data Custodian on the DD 2345 and approved by Defense Logistics Agency (DLA). The DD 2345 must be approved prior to requesting access to CUI in SAM.gov. Contractors are responsible for coordinating with their CAGE code?s Data Custodian POC to request access to CUI. For additional information, visit the DLA website for the Joint Certification Program: ?https://www.dla.mil/HQ/LogisticsOperations/Services/JCP/.? PIEE SOLICITATION MODULE FOR ELECTRONIC PROPOSAL SUBMISSION Offers and responses to the solicitation shall be submitted using the instructions in Section L of the solicitation. ?If the solicitations Section L instruction to offerors state the PIEE Solicitation module will be used for electronic proposal submission, Contractors are required to register in PIEE to obtain access to the solicitation module. ?To register in PIEE, go to https://piee.eb.mil/, and click Register. Going forward, all new entities registering in GSA's System for Award Management (SAM), as well as existing registrations being updated or renewed, will require the submission of an original, signed notarized letter identifying the authorized Entity Administrator for the entity associated with the Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) number. ?Effective June 11, 2018, entities who create or update their registration in SAM.gov to apply only for federal assistance opportunities such as grants, loans, and other financial assistance programs, have a notarized letter on file within 30 days of registration. ?Additionally, Effective June 29, 2018, all non-Federal entities who create or update their registration in SAM.gov, have a notarized letter on file within 30 days of registration. ?It is recommended that all interested parties be aware that processing this additional information may take several days and are proactive in maintaining the SAM registrations in an ""Active"" status as the government cannot award to an entity without an ""Active"" SAM registration. ?More information can be found at www.gsa.gov/samupdate. *DETAILED DESCRIPTION ?? This notice is the posting of the Request for Proposal for this requirement. All responsible sources must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) database at the following website: https://www.sam.gov/portal/public/SAM/. ?NEW - All proposals must be submitted in the PIEE System. Offers to the solicitation shall be submitted via PIEE Solicitation Module, a new secure portal, for proposal submissions per the instructions in Section L of the solicitation. Offerors are required to register in PIEE to obtain access to the solicitation module (step-by-step directions for registering and posting proposals in PIEE are included in the attachments to this solicitation) and can register in PIEE, go to https://piee.eb.mil/, and click Register.? Written responses shall be submitted by e-mail to the point(s) of contact listed below no later than 5 days from this notice date.? Payton Sutton? Email: payton.r.sutton.civ@us.navy.mil? Brad Watson? Email: john.b.watson1.civ@us.navy.mil? CONTROLLED UNCLASSIFIED INFORMATION (CUI) Contractors must be certified through Defense Logistics Information Services (DLIS) in order to access Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) or Export Controlled Information. Access to CUI is limited, to a single point of contact (POC) per CAGE code, who is listed as the Data Custodian on the DD 2345 and approved by Defense Logistics Agency (DLA). The DD 2345 must be approved prior to requesting access to CUI in SAM.gov. Contractors are responsible for coordinating with their CAGE code?s Data Custodian POC to request access to CUI. For additional information, visit the DLA website for the Joint Certification Program: ?https://www.dla.mil/HQ/LogisticsOperations/Services/JCP/.? PIEE SOLICITATION MODULE FOR ELECTRONIC PROPOSAL SUBMISSION Offers and responses to the solicitation shall be submitted using the instructions in Section L of the solicitation. ?If the solicitations Section L instruction to offerors state the PIEE Solicitation module will be used for electronic proposal submission, Contractors are required to register in PIEE to obtain access to the solicitation module. ?To register in PIEE, go to https://piee.eb.mil/, and click Register. Going forward, all new entities registering in GSA's System for Award Management (SAM), as well as existing registrations being updated or renewed, will require the submission of an original, signed notarized letter identifying the authorized Entity Administrator for the entity associated with the Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) number. ?Effective June 11, 2018, entities who create or update their registration in SAM.gov to apply only for federal assistance opportunities such as grants, loans, and other financial assistance programs, have a notarized letter on file within 30 days of registration. ?Additionally, Effective June 29, 2018, all non-Federal entities who create or update their registration in SAM.gov, have a notarized letter on file within 30 days of registration. ?It is recommended that all interested parties be aware that processing this additional information may take several days and are proactive in maintaining the SAM registrations in an ""Active"" status as the government cannot award to an entity without an ""Active"" SAM registration. ?More information can be found at www.gsa.gov/samupdate."

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,FL,AIR CUSHION VEHICLE (ACV) PROTOTYPE DEVELOPMENT AND ENGINEERING SUPPORT OTHER TRANSACTION AUTHORITY,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Sep 30, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/ee5a95885d83414e9cae8d04da67fee3/view,"N61331-22-SN-Q23
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,brandon.d.hayes11.civ@us.navy.mil,,"AIR CUSHION VEHICLE (ACV) PROTOTYPE DEVELOPMENT AND ENGINEERING SUPPORT OTHER TRANSACTION AUTHORITY The Naval Surface Warfare Center Panama City Division (NSWC PCD) has a requirement to establish design, prototyping, and support-service capabilities in support of ACV Hull, Mechanical and Electrical (HM&E) systems and capabilities development for legacy Landing Craft Air Cushion (LCAC) and LCAC-100 class craft. Capabilities established during this effort will include HM&E technical data package development including engineering services, product procurement services, first article LIMITED production development and final product delivery. In addition to the capabilities established for this effort, the Contractor shall, as specified in individual orders issued under the contract, develop, test, manufacture and deliver prototype and limited production articles including but not limited to LCAC and LCAC-100 class electrical, machinery, auxiliary, and hull systems. The Contractor shall be able to develop and refine designs, produce technical data packages, and produce final components or assemblies based off technical information provided at any stage in a product?s development cycle. Contractor shall provide all personnel, materials, and facilities to accomplish tasking as specified in orders to be issued under the resulting Other Transaction Authority (OTA) agreement through non-traditional defense contractors or small business concerns. A non-traditional defense contractor is an entity that is not currently performing and has not performed, for at least one-year period preceding the solicitation of sources for the other transaction, any contract or subcontract for the DoD that is subject to full coverage under the cost accounting standards (CAS). The term ""small business"" means a small business concern as defined under section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632). A ?prototype project? is defined as a prototype project addressing a proof of concept, model, reverse engineering to address obsolescence, pilot, novel application of commercial technologies for defense purposes, agile development activity, creation,? design, development, demonstration of technical or operational utility, or combinations of the foregoing. A process, including a business process, may be the subject of a prototype project. 10 USC 4022: Authority of the Department of Defense to carry out certain prototype projects applies to this announcement. Interested non-traditional defense contractors or small business concerns meeting the abovementioned definitions shall provide a capabilities statement tailored to the prototyping needs delineated in the attached draft statement of work. All questions shall be directed to Mr. Brandon Hayes, at brandon.d.hayes11.civ@us.navy.mil. This announcement will be amended as needed to reflect the answers to any questions received via a Q&A attachment."

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,GA,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Shower Trailers,Federal,,Department of Defense,Today ,Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/f4fd4e1c064145769f12d21833deec6f/view,"M0026322AL03
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,kevin.ortega@usmc.mil,,"THIS IS A SOURCE SOUGHT SYNOPSIS ONLY. This is NOT a Request for Quotation and in no way obligates the Government to award any contract/purchase order. The purpose of this Source Sought Synopsis is to seek out interested businesses capable of fulfilling this product requirement. Regional Contracting Office Parris Island is performing market research to determine available sources that can provide Portable Shower Trailers in support of Hurricane evacuation efforts in Albany, GA.? In addition, interested vendors shall provide the following information: Is your business a small business under this NAICS code? Refer to the attached draft Performance Work Statement and respond base on the ability to provide those technical requirements. Are the services available under a GSA/FSS contract? If so, please provide the contract number. Cage code and DUNS number. Cage code and DUNS number must be registered in System for Award Management (https://www.sam.gov) Provide a contractor capabilities statement and electronic business card. The US Marine Corps, Regional Contracting Office, MCRD Parris Island, SC is issuing this Sources Sought/Request for Information (RFI) for Portable Shower Trailers: MCRDPI is looking for up to 325 Portable Shower Trailers:? -To incllude service and cleaning twice a day. -Estimated Hurricane Season:? 1 June 2022 through 30 November 2022. Period of performance dependant on anticipated Hurricane season dates. There is not a defined requirement yet and this Sources Sought is for market research and information purposes only. The government reserves the right to issue multiple contracts for this requirement."

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,carrie.l.holub.civ@army.mil,,"Army Contracting Command - Rock Island (ACC-RI) is seeking vendors with the capability to provide Modular Office with a quantity of 1 each in support of the Rock Island Arsenal - Joint Manufacturing and Technology Center (RIA-JMTC). At a minimum, interested vendors shall provide the following information with their response: - Company Name with POC Name and Contact Information (Name, Phone Number, and Email Address); - Company CAGE Code and Unique Entity ID; Response Date: 07 June 2022 by 4PM Central Time All questions shall be emailed due to current teleworking environment in place at Army Contracting Command - Rock Island. Telephone inquiries will not be accepted. All responses and questions shall be eamiled to ACC-RI Contract Specialist, Carrie Holub at carrie.l.holub.civ@army.mil. **This announcement is for market research and planning/information gathering purposes only. This is not a request for proposal/quote or an announcement of forthcoming solicitation, nor is it seeking vendor's to be places on a solicitation mailing list. No solicitation exists at this time. Therefore, responses to this announcement is voluntary for those interested vendors. The Government does not intend to award a purchase order/contract based on this market survey or otherwise pay for information solicited.**"

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,ME,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): 56--Missile Stanchions,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 9, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/1bff4b014a364a05806628081721370c/view,"N6278622T0016
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is N6278622T0016 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 332323 with a small business size standard of 500.00 employees. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified sellers may submit quotes. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-06-09 16:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be West Bath, ME 04530 The NAVSEA SUPSHIP - Bath requires the following items, Purchase Description Determined by Line Item, to the following: LI 001: Chrome Quarterdeck Missile Stanchions Please see buy attachment for an example Material: Highly Polished (mirror quality finish) chrome Welds: All welds must be continuous, no tac welding visible on final product Size specifications: Base Diameter: 10 ?? Base Thickness: 1 3/8? Overall Height: 39 ?? Top of base to top of Missile: 37 ?? Top of missile to middle of eyelet: 6 ?? Eyelet inside diameter: 1"" Diameter of missile top section: 1 ?? Diameter of missile bottom section: 2 ?? Top of base to bottom of fins: 16 ?? Number of fins: 4, 8, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested Offerers must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, NAVSEA SUPSHIP - Bath intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing quotes, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. NAVSEA SUPSHIP - Bath is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time quotes. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their quote using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a quote on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerers that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith quotes, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should Offerers require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. In addition to providing pricing at www.FedBid.com for this solicitation, each Offeror must provide any required, NON-PRICING responses (e.g. technical proposal, representations and certifications, etc.) so that they are received no later than the closing date and time for this solicitation. Submissions can be sent to clientservices@fedbid.com. This solicitation requires registration with the System for Award Management (SAM) prior to award, pursuant to FAR 4.1102 and other applicable regulations and guidelines. Information can be found at www.sam.gov. Registration must be ""ACTIVE"" at the time of award. All Bids must be valid for 30 days from the closing date for this solicitation. No exceptions or qualifications. New equipment ONLY, NO grey market or refurbished products. Items must be in original packaging, never used, and not altered in any way. Components of the requested equipment, to include memory, must be manufacturer-approved and may not be compatible, remanufactured, or refurbished equipment. All items must be covered by manufacturer?s warranty and procured through a manufacturer approved distribution channel. Sellers must be able to document their ability to provide items through manufacturer approved distribution channels upon request. The Seller confirms to have sourced all products submitted in this Bid from manufacturer-approved channels for Federal sales, in accordance with all applicable laws and manufacturer?s current applicable policies at the time of purchase. Seller must be able to support both the product sale and product pricing, in accordance with applicable manufacturer certification / specialization requirements. If software is provided or included, Seller shall, upon request, provide Buyer with a copy of the End User License Agreement. Seller certifies that all software is licensed originally to Buyer as the original licensee authorized to use the software. All bid prices must include shipping FOB Destination CONUS (CONtinental U.S.). No partial shipments are permitted, unless otherwise specified by Contracting Officer at time of award. The selected Offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions. FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial, applies to this acquisition. The selected Offeror must submit a completed copy of the provision at 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications - Commercial Items. FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition. The following FAR clauses in paragraph (b) of FAR clause 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, will apply: 52.222-21, 52.222-26, 52.222-35, 52.222-36, 52.222-37, 52.225-13, 52.232-34. The full text of a FAR clause may be accessed electronically at http://www.acquisition.gov/far/ 52.204-13, 52.204-19, 52.204-23, 52.204-24, 52.204-25, 52.204-26, 52.209-10, 52.212-3 Alt I, 52.212-2 52.219-28, 52.219-6 DEV, 52.222-26, 52.222-36, 52.222-50, 52.223-18, 52.225-13, 52.232-1, 52.232-23, 52.232-33, 52.232-39, 52.232-40, 52.232-8, 52.233-1, 52.233-3, 52.233-4, 52.243-1, 52.246-1, 52.249-1, 52.249-8, 52.253-1, 252.203-7000, 252.203-7002, 252.203-7005, 252.204-7000, 252.204-7003, 252.204-7008, 252.204-7009, 252.204-7015, 252.204-7016, 252.204-7017, 252.204-7018, 252.204-7019, 252.211-7003, 252.215-7013, 252.225-7001, 252.225-7048, 252.231-7000, 252.232-7003, 252.232-7010, 252.243-7001, 252.244-7000, 252.247-7023, 52.204-24, 52.212-4, 52.212-5, 52.212-5 DEV, 52.213-4, 52.217-8, 52.252-2, 52.252-6, 252.204-7006, 252.232-7006, G-232-H002, G-232-H005 Additional information for the above terms and conditions can be found here www.acquisitions.gov."

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,MD,8(a) Sole Source (FAR 19.8): Bruker Quantax EDX Service Maintenance,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 8, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/23f006a578044c79bb163b24e1223977/view,"N00174-22-SIMACQ-R1-
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,shannon.cloud-wooten@navy.mil,,"THIS IS A NOTICE OF INTENT TO SOLE SOURCE, NOT A REQUEST FOR A QUOTE (RFQ).? A RFQ WILL NOT BE ISSUED AND QUOTES WILL NOT BE REQUESTED. Naval Surface Warfare Center Indian Head Division (NSWC, IHD), intends to award a firm fixed price contract on a noncompetitive basis to Bruker AXS LLC, 5465 E. Cheryl Pkwy, Madison, WI 53711 to provide the following service: Preventive maintenance and emergency services for one (1) EDX S/N RON1545 SOW is attached This action is be undertaken in accordance with FAR 13.106 (b) Soliciting from a single source, on the basis that the vendor is the only known source capable of meeting the government?s requirements The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) for this requirement is 423510. The FSC code is AJ11. The resulting contract will be a firm fixed price contract.? Negotiation being conducted using other than full and open competition procedures pursuant to authority of 10 U.S.C. 2304 (C) (1). This Notice of Intent is not a request for quotes. Interested parties may identify their interests and capability to respond to this requirement by June 8, 2021 at 10AM (EST). Any response to this notice must show clear and convincing evidence that competition would be advantageous to the Government. Information received will be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether or not to conduct a competitive procurement. The determination not to compete this proposed contract action is solely within the discretion of the Government. The Government will not be responsible for any costs incurred by responding to this notice. Responses to this electronic notice must be made by 10:00 a.m. EST on June 8, 2021. Interested vendors must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) at https://www.sam.gove/portal/public/SAM.? Oral communications are not acceptable in response to this notice. Interested parties shall e-mail all statements, quotes, and capabilities to Shannon Wooten, via email: shannon.cloud-wooten@navy.mil and must provide clear and concise documentation indicating a vendor's bona fide capability."

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,MD,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): MK22 Rocket Motor Towing Bridles and Button Lugs,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 13, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/b39c9d2388c24ffe95b25828f6416210/view,"N0017422R0054
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,bridget.m.taylor.civ@us.navy.mil,,"The Naval Surface Warfare Center, Indian Head Division (NSWC IHD), intends to award a firm-fixed price (FFP) contract on a competitive basis to the offeror with the lowest price technically acceptable for fabrication of button lug band and towing bridle assemblies used for assembly in MK 22 Rocket Motors. The resultant contract will be a supply type contract, with a base period of one (1) year and two (2) option years. The Government anticipates an award date on or before 30 September 2022. The contractor will fabricate button lug band and towing bridle assemblies used for assembly in MK 22 Rocket Motors at Naval Surface Warfare Center Indian Head Division (NSWC IHD). The associated North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is 332999. The associated Product Service Code (PSC) is 1340. The proposed contract action is for supplies, for which the Government intends to solicit and negotiate with full and open competition under the authority of Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 6.401(a)(2), ""The award will be made on the basis of price and other price-related factors."" Vendors who feel capable of providing the services referenced above shall fully identify their capabilities to provide the stated hardware within ten (10) days after publication of this synopsis. The solicitation number must be in all notice responses. Direct any questions to Sara Cooper at sara.j.cooper4.civ@us.navy.mil."

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,MD,CKU-5 W/O 1146,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 20, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/182d3c1124e244eb8ed48cba69454421/view,"N0017422Q0063
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,jodi.fields@navy.mil,,"N0017422Q0063 This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for non-commercial items prepared in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. Naval Surface Warfare Center Indian Head Division (NSWC IHD), located in Indian Head, Maryland intends to award a firm fixed price (FFP) purchase order using Simplified Acquisition Procedures for: Protective Cap, Locking Pin, Nozzle Cup and Tang Spring. This solicitation will be competed as full and open. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation. Quotes are being requested under Request for Quotation (RFQ) no. N0017422Q0063. The NAICS code is 332710 and the business size standard is 500. The provisions and clauses included and/or incorporated in this solicitation document are those in effect through the Federal Acquisition Circular. This RFQ incorporates all provisions and clauses in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular FAC 2020-01 and the Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS) DPN 20190531. The Government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible vendor whose quote, conforming to the solicitation that will be most advantageous to the Government, price and other factors considered. The Government intends to evaluate all timely quotes received from eligible vendors on a lowest price technically acceptable (LPTA) basis. The Government intends to evaluate quotations and award a contract without discussions with quoters. The Government intends to make 2 awards based of this solicitation. The Government reserves the right to conduct discussions if the Contracting Officer later determines them to be necessary. Evaluation Factors (in order of importance) 1. Technical ? Quotes must reflect the required specifications included in the RFQ. 2. Price ? Quotes must include all applicable costs. In order to submit a proposal, technical drawings must be requested. Technical Drawings: This procurement includes unclassified controlled technical information assigned a restricted distribution statement which is export controlled. To receive this unclassified controlled technical information, an Offeror must be currently certified through the United States/Canada Joint Certification Program. To become certified for receipt of the technical documents, a U.S. Offeror must submit a completed DD Form 2345 to the U.S./Canada Joint Certification Office. Canadian Offerors may submit either a completed DD Form 2345 or DSS-MAS 9379 for certification. In addition, a copy of the company's State/Provincial Business License, Incorporation Certificate, sales Tax Identification Form or other documentation which verifies the legitimacy of the company must accompany all DD Form 2345s. Additional information on the Joint Certification Program and a checklist for completion of the DD Form 2345 is available at the following website: http://www.dla.mil/HQ/InformationOperations/Offers/Products/LogisticsApplications/JCP/. Offerors are encouraged to apply for certification as early as possible in order for processing and receipt of information to be completed in sufficient time to prepare a proposal before solicitation closing. If interested, technical drawings need to be requested by contractor prior to submission date. ITAR certification is required to be provided prior to technical drawing release. Drawing requests must be made via email to Jodi.l.fields.civ@us.navy.mil and david.a.greaves4.civ@us.navy.mil by Wednesday, 01 June 2022 10:00 AM EST. Questions/clarification regarding this solicitation must be submitted via email to Jodi.l.fields.civ@us.navy.mil and david.a.greaves4.civ@us.navy.mil by Wednesday, 08 June 2022 10:00 AM EST. All responses will be provided by COB Monday 13 June 2022. Quote packages are due by 20 June 2022 10:00 AM EST. Late quotes will not be considered. Quote packages shall be sent to Jodi.l.fields.civ@us.navy.mil and david.a.greaves4.civ@us.navy.mil and contain a cover sheet that provides the following information: 1. Official Company Name; 2. Point of contact including name and phone number; and 3. DUNS number and Cage Code. The Points of Contact for this acquisition is 1. Jodi Fields, at Jodi.l.fields.civ@us.navy.mil 2. Dr. David Greaves, at david.a.greaves4.civ@us.navy.mil"

The associated North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is 332999. The associated Product Service Code (PSC) is 1340.?
